Dinner There are two types of courses, both ate and share. Appetizer, main and salt is darker, but acidity was tight. Service or attempted to lower the dish even nearly eaten impatient, feeling restless. Wonder if good in Din Tai Fung opposite.

We had a table outside at Sky on 57 and got the fantastic view. The atmosphere was nice, with good music, free drink for ladies as it was ladies night and awesome food. The dishes are maybe a bit small so if you are hungrey you should order 3-5 small dishes. The spicy tuna salad was amazing!

Review Title/URL: "Worth a visit, if only for the views"
Review: My wife and I visited Sky on 57 restaurant with a group for our last evening in Singapore, prior to boarding a cruise ship bound for Dubai. Our ?Gastronomic Set Menu? by Chef Justin Quick included the following courses: Hokkaido Scallop ? Salmon trout roe with micro greens and Ginger flower dressing French Foie Gras ? Pan seared, JQ?s foie gras xiao long bao and Wild mushrooms with truffle jus Maine Lobster ? Wok fried, coated with ochazuke arare. Asian greens and JQ?s straits sweet and sour chili sauce Australian M5 Wagyu Trip Tip ? Char grilled steak with asparagus, uni butter and Bonito infused yuzu pepper sauce Citrus Heaven ? Marinated citrus lime sponge, orange mouse, Orange gel, fennel confit and tangerine sorbet The entire menu was accompanied by a glass of selected wine, beer or a non-alcoholic alternative. The first three courses were really wonderful. But never having eaten Wagyu beef before, I was expecting a supremely tender and flavoursome steak. I subsequently learned that tri-tip is a cut of beef from the bottom sirloin, and is not one of the prime cuts. So although I enjoyed the flavour, my steak was slightly ?chewy? - and no better than an equivalent cut from a less prestigious breed of cattle. My dessert was a combination of tiny ?bits and pieces?, including sponge cake, and jelly, etc. Frankly, it was rather ordinary. This dinner was included in a tour package, so I cannot comment upon the price - although I am sure it wasn't cheap. However, spectacular views from the top of Marina Bay Sands provide sufficient reason to visit Sky on 57 for dinner, even if the costs reflect the premier location. Furthermore, there is no better place to watch the ?Wonder Full at Marina Bay Sands? laser light show, which starts at 8:00 pm. So overall, this was a memorable occasion, even though the main course and dessert did not quite match my expectations.
Went there to have lunch with the girlfriend's family and so I had the chance to take a bite of half the things on the menu. The food was very good and the view even better!

Review Title/URL: "I can't get enough of these views"
Review: Can't get enough of these amazing views. Similar to Ku De Ta (but not a full 360 degree view). A better place to eat and have drinks though and again, the views are everything here.

We had an early family dinner here. The food was excellent, the choice was very good and we were surprised that there are options for children (not in the menu, but they proved to be very flexible). The view is magnificient, so the dinner was really a special experience. The bill will be high (no problem to reach the minimum spend), but for a special occasion it's worth it.

Indoor or outdoor, the views are amazing as the restaurant is located at the edge of the bay. Try the scallops .... One if the best dishes on the menu. Sunday brunch also has an egg Benedict with avocado that can't be beat. RECOMMENDATION: reservation needed! except for very early Sunday, every other time we've been there, if we didn't have a reservation it was an hour wait.
One of the best views of Singapore. Staff is incredibly on the ball. Head Bartender is superb. Some great cocktails are made in this venue. Food is top end. A def must visit while in Singapore.

Although pricy this restaurant was definitely worth it. Our waiter was nothing but friendly and was incredibly prompt when we needed anything and kept the wine glasses topped up sufficiently. I had the duck as a main course which was cooked to perfection. Then on the waiters recommendations we shared the salted caramel creme br–l‚e and it didn't disappoint. It was delicious! If you want a treat I would definitely recommend Spago.

Appetizer of lobster salad was taste To refreshing delicious combination of the source and fruit. Compatibility of food and wine also seems to me well considered, red wine we had with two delicious. Scenery is also beautiful, I enjoyed the manner in which gradually turned into a night scene.

Fantastic experience from the moment we arrived, we were initially shown to a small table in a bar area before being move to a larger table with a view towards Singapore skyline. The staff were friendly, attentive, ensuring we had sufficient drinks to accompany our food throughout. The food was delicious and included some signature dishes, which were fantastic. The views are stunning and you can go out onto the balcony area, to take some pictures of the Singapore skyline, defiantly something I would recommend and something I would do again. Far better experience than paying extortionate prices for a Singapore sling at the long bar.

my friends and I recently visited this very famous GR restaurant. We didn't much have problem reserving for a table (maybe because it's a weekday) in contrast with what other people say. Upon arrival, the hostess greeted us warmly and showed us to our table. She was very polite and nice. We like the vibe and ambience of the place, facing the waterfront of marina bay (good place for date night). Music is nice too. Our server we're very helpful in answering all our questions about the menu. The food came in fast (good thing because we were all hungry). The food is great, being a Gordon Ramsay fan, our expectation for his food is high, but he didn't fail to deliver. The pork belly is the best thing on the menu (highly recommended) and the scallops. The desserts were all fantastic too! Everything in this place is absolutely great, the only disappointment that we have was the asian/malaysian lady in black jacket ( we don't know if that's the manager or what), she lacks the warmth and friendliness that the rest of the staff has. She never smiles and she was frowning the whole time. It's such a disappointment for a nice place like this to hire a staff who lacks the energy and warmth to serve. are we going back? maybe

With some of the best views in Singapore and a lovely outside bar (including a smoking section) this has to be one of the places to enjoy dinner in this cosmopolitan city. Ok, its not cheap with mains coming in at around $100 Singapore, but the food quality was exceptional and everything we had tasted fresh and really good. Standout food included the Spago Tuna cones, a veal tartare, the angry lobster and the veal chops. Oddities included a discussion about the lamb, which came from Colorado and not New Zealand, and the waiter making a mistake about which of the 5 starters we ordered was the one to share. Our waiter also left before we did, shift ended?, which was rather odd. After our lovely dinner we moved outside and had a nightcap, and although we were the last guests we were left in peace with no hurry to leave. We would certaining return for a future visit. Well done Mr Puck!

Steak types of many things in the direction of Japan is delicious. While I think that luxury shops customer of shorts of tourists and T-shirt multiple-. The price is without the need to eat at all the way but cheaper than Japan Singapore.

Had late lunch there. The food was fantastic, especially turkey salad which was great. They serve fusion cuisine, prices are high but food is worth. I don`t mention the view since as a guest of MBS was not soimpressed.

Nothing special. Poorly motivated staff. High priced. Two dishes to eat with your 'hands'. No napkins. Mayonnaise for the fries was only delivered when the chips already on. Apparently this TV chef (Gordon Ramsay) for his "own affairs" no time. The same experience we had already been in London. Not recommended.

Venue: The restaurant is conveniently located in the Marina Bay Sands Shopping Center with a view of the harbor from the 1st floor. In the basement floor, it's open kitchen so you can see the chefs hard at work. The wide angle view with the glass windows doors expanding across the length of the entire restaurant makes it look bigger than it really is. There aren't that many tables, so you should make a reservation to avoid getting turned away at the door. Food: We ordered Sricha Shrimp to start, Black Cod and Rib Eye as 2 main entrees with 2 sides, mac n cheese and mashed potato. The shrimp was so so...didnt taste like anything and the cole slaw that came with it tasted like Bahn Mi, the Vietnamese sandwich. Pass on the shrimp. The 2 mains...black cod and rib eye both were just SPECTACULAR. Black cod was probably the best fish dish that I've had. It just melts in your moth. And the rib eye was just perfectly cooked. Juicy with the right proportion of tenderness and meaty texture. Sides: Both mashed potato and the mac n cheese were both good but nothing to write home about.

We had dinner here with our 2 children aged 2 and 4 in April. The were able to squeeze us in without a reservation. We ordered all our food from the share menu which was all so good! We eat out quite a bit at home, so are used to receiving good food and good service. This restaurant excelled in both of these areas! Our kids also loved the food (the aranchini was very popular!) My husband and I requested espresso martinis which weren't on the menu, but the bar staff were more than happy to make them anyway and they were perfect! If you want a delicious meal and drinks with great service, this is the place to go!

March 2016 was close to the fold, which joined the Singapore departure of the cruise tour. Tour in Mariner Bay Sands observatory tourism I was with, but was unable to outlook slowly in the tour with a time limit. I want to see the famous infinity pool, if possible, but paying to go up again entrance fee? If you are looking at around the site while trouble was deprived of the eye to the sentence "tricks without outlook admission". In short, there is a bar in Mariner Bay Sands 57-floor, because it does not need the money to enter the store, I'm such that alcohol can outlook may not bother to pay the entrance fee if the order. Because it outlook in the pay liquor price minute to drink can outlook! This was to go only to the lucky. The bar is hot - it is outdoors. Store the liquor only have been to restaurant meals will be on the terrace seat. Because the wind blows it endures somehow, but was seated overlooking the restaurant askance and I wish you hit indoor cooler if possible. Of course, since you can not outlook if it is not this open area, I's gonna be ambitious .... We ordered beer 2 tablespoons. Is delicious Rozebiru of white beer and raspberry flavor. I like to drink inveterate I, I had to order another glass of an additional. Tropical citrus cocktail of this bar recommended ... was very delicious drink. Even beer only to the service fee will be handsome price if make yourself understood the chip. But, but Will was close to enjoy drinking in tricks street entrance fee if up there, I have considerably over budget due to the addition. Because it pains came to Singapore even sweat, might this location not be removed again. I thought that it was good because I enjoyed a good atmosphere but did not stay at Mariner Bay Sands.

When you are up that high, it is hard not to be at the top of your feelings. Sky High Tea was my choice that weekday afternoon and we were led to a cosy area where my friend could fill me in with all the happenings in her life - we call this girls-just-catching-up. Totally private dining area, close to the windows and we could occasionally look out to the glaring sun. Service was great and menu was explained to us very clearly - the high tea was non-refillable. I was there to taste the Foie Gras Xiao Long Bao (just one serving) - it was unforgettably good and wished I could have more and the mushroom Cappuccino made me want to slurp another cup. The Seasonal Sweet Creations were excellent and suited for small eaters like me, and portion wise, the combination was well thought with a good balance of sweets and savoury. My friend thought the portion was a tad too small for her. Now, the view. Right after the meal, you could walk around the open area and capture the top view of the city - that is a great draw. Also a sweet mention, there was a wedding couple who held their tea-ceremony at the restaurant and what a blissful afternoon for me. Congratulations to them and thanks for the great afternoon at Sky-on-57. You will see me more!

Great Sunday roast! Lovely location Can't fault a thing food lovely we had beef roast lunch followed by a a shareing desert plate for two and also Eton mess and rhubarb and apple crumble There were four of us! Staff excellent nothing a problem too them Only thing we would ask is a little more gravy would defiantly eat here again??

Review Title/URL: "Lazy lunch at the top of the sands hotel"
Review: A laid back country feel on the top of the marina bay sands. Food was decent, we had the club sandwich, burger, tuna tartar and the tagliatelle. All expertly put together, nothing too fancy or innovative. The hostess seemed a bit uncomfortable in her platform stilettos which we felt was a bit of a strange look for the place. Otherwise service is very good and we recommend the cocktails.

In the context of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, where everything has a lot of "oversize" size, it could not be outdone by the breakfast in the hotel restaurant the Rise, one of the four present, really worthy of a grand wedding dinner. There is plenty of choice of sweets, jumped, fish, meat, fruit vegetable all that getting lost between the various banks. Quality good friendly service and quick.

The entire experience was described simply as wow. Ambience, service, wine list, food quality, attention to details. A big fat wow.
Amazing atmosphere bussing with life. Lights were dim just right and service was professional and warm at the same time. Not easily achievable. The entire crew were stars! Paul, Ruben(hilarious), David the amazing sommelier, Tiong!
The starters, sliders, snacks, bread, sides, tasting of NY sirloins, desserts, stunning!!
I wish I made enough money to be here on a regular basis. Keep up the great job bright shining star!

Went here for a special birthday meal. The food was excellent, we both had fillet steaks, mine was on the bone which I've not heard of before. Both were perfectly cooked and had excellent flavour.

A little strange for us that it is located in a shopping mall, but once inside you can forget about that. The service was very good if not just a little bit over attentive at times, but not enough to be annoying.

We really enjoyed and can recommend.
Were already after midnight and was like finding an oasis here in Singapore, fabulous service, very good food and very practical for who is staying at the Marina Bay Sands
The quality of dishes are simply awesome... service staff are attentive with great servicez.... and chefs are super interactive. You will see great effort from chef planning...

Review Title/URL: "Don't bother going unless you order the set menu!!"
Review: Waited along time for cocktails to arrive - when they did arrive one of them had to be sent back as it didn't taste great. On arrival it was very clear the staff didn't want us to have the a la carte menu - rather being pushed the set menu (which I am sure tasted incredible - and did look fantastic with its pairings.. From memory this cost 270 sgd pp with drinks pairing). This being said, I think by not ordering the set menu you are completely 'forgotten' in this restaurant. Of course I do not have a problem with pouring my own wine at all, but when you are paying a certain high price for the '5 star dining experience', you hope they come over a few more times than just taking your order and bringing you the bill. The tables surrounding being treated like celebrities, it was actually quite amusing to watch how the staff acted differently depending on what menu you chose. Sloppy service / not great cocktails / great lobster rolls.. Unfortunately won't be rushing back..

Came here with my friend to have dinner before we went up the 57th floor of Marina Bay Sands to have a drink and check out the view. The food here is cooked to perfection, so full of flavour. Just delicious. The service here is as it should be. Waiters are attentive, came back to the table on several occasions to check on us. I've worked and managed restaurants most of my life, and this is the way I was taught service. Spot on, next time I'm back in Singapore I will definitely come back.

Pros: Fish and Chips was fantastic. Bread basket good. Good choice of wine good, and cocktails looked amazing (we did not partake) Cons: Burger was under cooked, taken back and the next one was slightly more cooked. I eat my steak medium-rare I like my burgers medium...this was still mooing. Only two beers on tap, hubby disappointed. We will go back because other expats that have lived here longer than me love this place...unless the experience is a total disaster I will always give a place another try. Plus I am a massive fan of Gordon Ramsey.
Was disappointed, expected this to be much better. Simple meals and overpriced. Great vibe, venue and service. Would just go here from some drinks if I was to go again.
The menu didn't look appealing at the first look but it ended up that all the choices were perfect specially the calamari and the beef
We went for lunch during the week and had the four course business lunch which was terrific value. Superb food, the blue swimmer crab soup was amazing. And as for the setting and the view - WOW!

Brought friends who's in town for the first time to this bar. Absolutely gorgeous night view and great place if you want a chic night out with a few close friends. There's option to sit outdoors or indoors but I'd highly recommend you call and book in advance.
Excellent Buffet and staff. Probably the best in Singapore and we have tried a good few over the years. We shall return.
We enjoyed the very good lunch Buffet.. You cannot eat all this in 2 hours and it wont fit all in your tummy. Too much choices from appetizer, main course and Dessert.
Incredibly varied buffet lunch in the iconic Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Very good value. Very helpful allergen labelling. Good service. Excellent value.

Went here with business associate and it delivered. amazing to be in a mall and have such a high end restaurant...Had the prosciuto/mozzarella app- it was over the top... yes the price is singaporean (as in everything is expensive here compared to other areas of world). Chose a bottle of red, that was amazing - italian of course. had pasta app (each of us). his a clam linguine- looked amazing- and mine- home made pasta rolls and meat sauce tthat was perfect for red wine. then we each had lamb- that was overly generous, but expensive. but cooked perfect. then 1 chocolate dessert

Two nights ago, my wife and I celebrated her birthday at Marina Bay Sands Spago restaurant. We were welcomed warmly and with entering the restaurant we left Singapore and arrived in another world. We chose the tasting menu and enjoyed a relaxed, almost three hour long journey with different tastes of food and wine. Chef Greg presented most of the courses in person and explained many intersting things to us. We loved the food, and in addition, the very kind presentation. Host and Sommelier Michael selected the wine pairing with european wines, but, as I asked for (we are coming from Germany), he was happy to present a californian selection, which I really enjoyed! Michael and Greg, accompanied by a dedicated team, made this evening a very special one for my wife and me. They did an outstanding job, and walked ?the special mile? many timest hat night. We spent a wonderful night at Spagos and will be happy to visit again during our next stay in Singapore.
Must! A do to make up for a view of the city of Singapore! A bit pricey though! SG $ 23.

Amazing tasting menu. Very satisfying. Dinner service is well paced and the staff very helpful. The wine selection is extravagant although a bit pricey. The view is breathtaking and will constantly distract you if you sit by the window.

Booked for lunch with a group of 16 people. At least two of us did not have our drinks orders taken at all, it was very inattentive service. Everyone who ate the pork belly felt ill later in the day. Expect to pay about $50-60 per person for and entr‚e and main, add another $20-25 for a drink and a side dish.

Review Title/URL: "300 usd a head, but really good evening at CUT"
Review: Amazing cocktails. Friendly service , not necessarily very knowledgeable but very friendly. The food was very good. The only thing I did not like was the bone marrow as a side addition. It really did not taste good.. The appetizers were great : pea soup , scallops in particular. Great Wagyu especially the snow .. Huge wine list , in which we managed to find a very good 175 bucks bottle ( not easy ) . Will come back definitively but this is only in the knowledge that you will pay a huge amount of money for It

Really such a lovely restaurant - we stopped by for cocktails on Christmas Eve and were blown away by how good they were! So we had to come back to eat! The service is top notch! Attention to detail and how everyone performs their roles should be a lesson for all restaurants in singapore to follow. The extras that come with the meal are plenty so don't eat too much if you want to finish your huge steak! Really an amazing meal.

Review Title/URL: "Awesome pizza! Cooked in a wood fire oven!"
Review: The pizzas here are delicious! The flavors and taste bring me back to certain parts of Italy. It is not overly priced (considering it's in MBS), averaging $30 a pie. Very good quality at an extremely reasonable price. Do not confuse this place with Osteria Mozza next door as the prices are HUGELY different.
Long overdue review of Sky on 57. I had the risotto for dinner and it was DIVINE! Perfectly al dente and the accompanying foie gras just melted in with the butter and the rice. HEAVENLY!

Iÿhave not been here since november 2015. The staff recalled my visit and waiters, manager came to say hello. Food here us excellent but go left on entry: right turn is pizza and packed and noisy. The menu is not large but exciting and dishes well presented. Wines are good quality. Well worth a visit.

Review Title/URL: "New Destination Restaurant at Marina Bay Hotel Rooftop"
Review: One of THE new places to eat in Singapore. Casual elegant with impeccable service and light modern cuisine. Both fish dishes we ordered were perfectly cooked. The tuna appetizer was the tastiest dish. Excellent wine list. Caramel souffl‚ is the must dessert choice. Book well ahead as its popular
Enjoying Singapore in a posh way. A good place to chill with good friends, good atmosphere. Impeccable.

From here you have the absolute view, and for lunch you can either from a small card eat (I had very tasty Chinese noodles from the wok with Wagyu Beef for 20S $), but there are also a delicious-sounding 3-speed dinner for $ 55S. However, the drink prices are quite high, but they are everywhere in Singapore. Friendly service and comfortable furniture on the terrace.

A worth trying buffet at the Rise if you get to visit Marina Bay Sands. Spacious environment, high ceiling for a restaurant where you can truly relax and enjoy the meal. Wide spread of selection, everything is just too tempting not to try. Fresh seafood, cooked dishes, noodles, tasty soups and desserts - just irresistible. All you need is just more time and enjoy the meal.
As good as advertised. Love the fish and chips. The burger also excellent. The portions are huge!! The waiter and waitresses are very friendly. Love to comeback here!!

Not the best steakhouse in Singapore but well up there. The service was great as was the food. Maybe a little bit pricey for what it was? One annoying thing I see regularly in certain restaurants - A beer menu with 10+ options & I've never heard of one them? I don't go into a restaurant to drink beer per se, but I do like an odd one pre my meal but why restaurants such as this think they are better than serving recognised worldwide brands is beyond me? Instead I get offered a plethora of local/unknown beers that taste like dish water. Come on guys, if you think you are the connoisseurs of worldwide beers, at least give Neanderthals like me just one option I recognise just in case I don't fancy your local rubbish?

Review Title/URL: "Great oysters and lobster roll - perfect dinner option in the MBS"
Review: I really enjoyed the nice service/attentive staff, and great food! A bit pricey, but quality is great and location as well :) I chose oysters as a starter (very fresh and tasty - served with onion and vinegar, tabasco) and afterwards a lobster roll. My best lobster roll experience - the brioche bread was perfectly toasted, awesome lobster salad with avocado, chili and celery. Definitely going back there for the roll and oysters!

Review Title/URL: "Beautiful bar and great cocktail/finger food selection"
Review: I went there for cocktails on a Friday night, and really enjoyed my time there. The bar and restaurant "Spago" is on the rooftop of the MBS hotel, near the giant infinity pool. From the other side, you can see the Gardens by the Bay. The beverages menu is in line with the expectations of a high end bar, I had a good Japanese whisky. Service I friendly, attentive. Finger food is great! We had sushi and a special and tasty dessert with coconut and mango (see picture)

Review Title/URL: "Stunning location makes for a great evening."
Review: An attractive new enterant into the bar/lounge scene in Singapore. Scores with its amazing location , perched on top of Marina Bay Sands. The views are tuning day or night. My preference would be to begin with sun down cocktails and party into he night.... As the sun sets. Great choice of cocktails and eats. The spicy tuna in waffle cones is interesting as are the beef sliders. It's a lovely area that looks into the famous infinity pool . One only wishes we did not have to stare at the never ending stream of hotel guests in their bathrobes and slippers while we corn our party best!!

Review Title/URL: "Fantastic food with a view to match"
Review: Have been a regular visitor to Singapore in the past 12 months, but this was my first taste of some fine dining. It was planned to have a fine dining experience and someone had mentioned Sky on 57, so it was a good option. Plus had chance to see local celebrity chef Justin Quek. It was easy and straight forward to make a reservation online, and on arrival they had my reservation in the books and was shown to out table next at the window with a great view. We had time browse through the menu, which I had seen online, but was told of the business set lunches were available too. We both went for a 4 course set with a starter, soup, main and dessert. $65 per person. A great selection of bread was offered and was offered more once we finished. Declined the second offering as we didn't want to fill up on bread. First course: Foie Gras Xiao Long Bao, Organic Egg with slow cooked Iberico Pork Belly and Braised Leek. Both dishes were great, but the flavour that came from the Foie Gras in the Xiao Long Bao stood out by a mile. Amazing. Soup: Double cooked pork broth, Artichoke Veloute. The double cooked broth is a fusion soup, but definitely felt more Chinese style. The options on the menu were very much a mixture of local dishes and western. Illustrated in our main course. Main Course: Roasted Lamb Shoulder, Fish Curry. The lamb was cooked perfectly, great flavour and tender. Fish curry was a play on the local Fish head curry, was good. Not very spicy, and the fish you could tell was quite fresh. I was left wondering what fish was used, I couldn't really tell. It did wasn't a fish had a strong fish flavour. Dessert: We took a range of different desserts from the dessert trolley. Coffee to finish off a fantastic meal. Service was fantastic. Faultless, waiting staff new how to present each dish as they came, water was constantly filled, and everyone was friendly and walked around with a smile. We were quite full by the end of it, so walked it off with a hit if window shopping in the mall below. Fantastic experience, and is definitely worth a try if you are looking for some fine dining.

So, eating at a Gordon Ramsey outpost in Singapore would seem sadly unimaginative , but, after days of down n dirty hawker markets and seafood restaurants, I just wanted a western meal. Stopped in at 3 for a late lunch, sat at the window bar looking over the bay. Everything from start to finish, to the smallest detail conjured Gordon on one of his shows demanding perfection. Started with a cauliflower salad, amazing subtlety of flavors, hints of spice, and just barely rich enough. Ordered their coconut almond drink, amazing again to the point I siphoned in water from my water glass to make it last longer. Stake and Alex pie for my main. Tender, sublime beef with a perfect crust and that came with a small side of spatzle with more flavor than spatzle has ever had. 5 stars for food, if I'd had a proper res and table I'd give 5...

Salat not fresh, but service was great, lovely place to go after a long day in the sun, enjoyed the various cool fruit drinks. Noticed that other people's food Dit not look apertising, so time for a new chef there.

Ate dinner at Gordon Ramsey's Bread Street Kitchen at Marina Bay in Singapore tonight. Started off with a complementary bread basket, delicious bread and we were offered more - not sure whether this would have been chargeable. I had a burger with Monterey Jack cheese which sounded delicious and was very good. The accompanying chips (French fries) were soft and soggy and not nice at all. My friend's Black Cod lived up to expectations. I then had the cheesecake which was whiskey based with blueberry ice cream. It was very good but not exceptional. My friend had the banana sponge pudding which she said was a bit dry. But all in all we enjoyed our meals. We had a glass each of a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc which was good but my friend commented after we had left that her serving was actually smaller than mine. I hadn't noticed. The restaurant is in a nice setting along the waterfront and can be accessed from the outside or from within the Marina Bay Sands Shopping Mall. One thing to note - the restaurant has no toilets - you have to go outside of the restaurant into the Mall to use the public toilets. A little odd, I thought. Our bill came to $186 SD including service.

Fantastic private dining room at the rear of the restaurant, floor to ceiling glass that doubled at the wine cellar. Food and service was on the spot - steak super succulent and the sides amongst the best I've ever had.

We had Tripe and pork belly for entr‚e and we were totally impressed by the authenticity and flavours. Not many restaurants outside Italy offer these old recipes. The waiting staff were courteous knowledgable and professional . We had clams and fettucine which was a bit disappointing because the clams were not cooked fully as they were plump clams and needed maybe 2 more minutes to cook but the maitre d' resolved the issue straight away and offered us ne freshly cooked plates but we were full by that stage and he was kind enough to take the returned plates off our bill and apologise. I had a negroni which was amazing and the complimentary dessert of Panna cotta was Amazing Will definitely come back to this restaurant
The home is perfect, the decor is nice, what we had was good without the addition is too salty. So we recommend.

We were staying at The Fullerton Bay Hotel and decided to go for a stroll and check out the other side of the Bay. What a surprise another shopping centre ( top notch designers everywhere ) we enjoyed a few drinks and dinner at the DB oyster Bar service was good as were the meals , the casino is in the same complex worth a visit before or after a little flutter .

this place is a disgrace. It is who you know in this place that helps you to get service and food. we stayed at the Fairmont hotel and strolled down to Marina Sands to grab dinner and drinks and decided to experience 57. The minute we walked in we were told there is no free table and had to sit on the bar with our back to the views. After a few minutes we clearly saw a few empty tables and when I argued with the girl that tables have no reservation sign on them she decided to give us a table . We wanted to order oysters just like another table next to us she said they donot have anymore so we ordered drinks. Half an hour later a group walked it and ordered oysters and voila there appeared OYSTERS!!! I was disgusted by the way we were treated because I thought it was a place that had different service/ food for different clientele!!! I think the locals and customers that stay at the hotel get the special treatment! We paid $60 for 2 drinks and walked away in disgust. I made sure I told them that customers should be treated with respect. Horrible place and not worth the visit. views are only of container ships waiting in the sea. Donot bother to go for the view or the service. If you are hungry you will not be served if you are not a special client!!!

If you are a foodie and have the opportunity to splurge, Waku Ghin is one of the finest venue with a luxurious culinary experience to offer. Setting aside the difficulties we had navigating our way around Marina Bay Sands to find the restaurant, the whole dining experience really started as soon as you walk in the door. Service and Experience: Awesome. I love how there is a "private" room where it is simply you and the chef as he cooked the dishes in front of us. It's not a teppanyaki bar so do not fear having any eggs being thrown at you. ;) Meal: Exclusively exquisite. There are no other place to taste the dishes. Price: $1000+ for two and it was worth it. Notes: If you are allergic to seafood or if you (or your date) is picky with food, I certainly would have to suggest you think twice about going as you may not find it enjoyable in many levels.

We dined here prior to attending a show (Blue Man Group) in the Marina Bay Sands Theater. The menu was fixed as we were on a limited schedule, however we were very satisfied. The crab entree was very good. The steaks were spectacular and cooked to perfection and the chicken was excellent as well as being a huge portion. We struggled to finish. The whole meal was complimented by excellent wines and very good service, particularly that of Angie who looked after us for the whole meal. An excellent dining experience and we will definitely be back.
Marina Bay Hotel ... Try the cocktail bar 57 floors .. price is affordable and the location ... out of the atmosphere to see the city at a glance.

had a buffet dinner there, would say their buffet isnt worth trying, nor i would say it is value of money. Yes, it has a wide variety of food, but after a 1.5 hours feast, the only meal i can recall is .. the laska and that's it.

We came here for a celebratory dinner. The food is generally of high quality but there is really nothing special about it. I had the set dinner menu, available before 7pm. For S$58+++, you get a 2 course meal. I ordered the kale caesar salad which I loved. The anchovy dressing paired well with the crunchy kale. The second course was the slow cooked salmon, which was cooked perfectly but the sauce accompanying it was a little too rich. After a few mouthfuls, I could not continue with the dish. Dessert we ordered a la carte and that was disappointing. I've had my fair share of chocolate lava cake and this one just did not make the grade. It was ordinary, to say the least and I really hated the caramel sauce. There was just too much sweet in one dish. The service was really so-so. The staff are not rude but they were not warm and welcoming. The word that comes to mind is perfunctory. No recommendations were made; there was little attention to detail that one would expect from a restaurant in this location, and they let the cat out of the bag. Let me explain: it was a birthday celebration and we had preordered dessert and were specific with our instructions on who the birthday person was. The waitress went straight to the birthday person and declared that dessert had already been ordered so the surprise was ruined. She did apologise and we are not big on surprises. I am writing this because I know many would be particular about this. Other than the above, we had a pleasant meal and evening.

Stunning place. We had the tasting menu, which was delicious. I particularly loved the scallop and the Wagu beef. My partner had the wine pairing, they have a very good selection of wines. Staff was attentive, we were very well looked after. We were asked before we started whether we wanted to walk around and take in the beautiful views of Singapore, which we did, well worth it. Please note though, there is no access to view the infinity pool, that's closed off by gates accessible only by hotel residents. A great experience overall.

Review Title/URL: "Take romantic date nights to a different high!"
Review: It was my wife's birthday week and what better an occasion to give her a surprise as all she knew was, it was another date night. It's a great fine dining experience, from entr‚e to dessert , the ambiance and the service was simply exquisite. I had let the staff know in advance the importance of the occasion and they did ensure we were looked after well. They were so talented that they sang a beautiful happy birthday song for my wife when they served the dessert with sparklers. The Chef's appetizer platter and the King Prawn Kataifi are an awesome way to start the dinner. They have a great selection of wines and spirits and some great scotch selections too. In main course I would definitely recommend the Australian Dorper Lamb which is an Asian pesto Crusted rack with grilled artichoke and truffle jus. Those wanting to try the JQs signature roasted crackling suckling pig , do try it. The pepper sauce on it makes it taste Devine. Definitely recommend it for a special occasion with your loved one , great ambiance, breath taking views and most certainly fine dining! Cheers Vijay
This would have to be one of the top 5 restaurants in Singapore. The food is absolutely divine with great flavours. Western food with a slight local influence. Expensive but worth the money.
Still one of the best restaurants on the planet ... Food, atmosphere and attention by staff is fantastic .. A must on your dinning experience list

Had breakfast here overlooking the waterfront. We ordered the omelette along with coffee. Enjoyed the experience and food, but have to say that the service could have been a bit more attentive. The restaurant was not overly busy at the time.
Very good food in Cut by Wolfgang Puck. The price is expensive but very high quality. Service was great and staffs were friendly!!
Very good food, the steak tartare was really good, according to my husband. Nice atmosphere, though a little dark. I found the prices on the high side, but that's the case with Singapore.
Good food, good service, good ambience. If you are looking for a reasonably priced meal this restaurant would tick the boxes. We tried his signature Fennel Sausage Pizza (pictured), really delicious.

Justin's restaurant is a no-risk place. Go there and be happy. We had a very nice dinner with a nice bottle Chianti. After dessert enjoying the marvelous view on Central Business District. Thank you Lord!

I was disappointed. It is also bad COSPA. Personally Sands overall customer answering has received an immature impression, but here was also up a seat in the middle because it did not meet the same dishes also mouth. I do not think another go.
Good food, friendly service, nice ambience with a great view of Singapore. Dessert was excellent. Rather pricey but that's the cost of living in this city.

It Singapore arrival was late at night, but there in the lobby of the accommodation of the Marina Bay Sands, I tried to use because it was open until midnight. Stomach even though crowded, but I wanted to break from a little drink with friends, we received a good impression are also substantial menu.
Restaurant very good food served from the atmosphere, it is unfortunately a bit noisy. Many guests and the music is not for a cozy conversation. The service very attentive and friendly.

Review Title/URL: "very nice food with a lovely view"
Review: what a great place for a restaurant. stayed in the tower 3 and went there for breakfast. What an amazing place with lovely service and great food.

Unbelievably good food in a friendly atmosphere. Excellent ingredients perfectly prepared. Forget your classic tepan experiences for a totally reinvented cooking discovery. From sea urchins with caviar to perfectly stemmed lobster, every dish was incentive and perfectly realized.

We were here in 2015 and everything was very good. A friend in Singapore suggested we meet here for lunch. We arrived a few minutes early were seated and some water delivered to the table. The menu caters both for meat lovers and vegetarians, we all had two courses each. Throughout the meal the staff were attentive, professional and courteous. Nothing too much trouble. It was just as I remembered it. A pleasant way to spend our last day in Singapore.
Reasonably priced. fast service and great pizza. Nice break from shopping. They serve Thin crust pizza. Great selection of wine.

It would be worthwhile going to this restaurant for the location and the view over Singapore alone, but the food is just as stunning. A thoughtful and interesting gastronomique menu, in which the slow cooked lobster, foie gras xiao long bao, the perfectly cooked duo of quail ( roasted and confit) and the textures of chocolate were the highlights. The accompanying wine flight was mainly French-the wines were excellent but if there is a criticism they could have been a little more exciting. Staff were friendly and attentive, and were able to discuss the food with knowledge and enthusiasm.

Wow!!!! This was our second time back at Adrift and they had really gone the extra mile to make it a special occasion! We had some incredible cocktails on arrival and the food itself was of a very high quality and beautifully presented. We were very lucky also to meet Chef David Myers who certainly made us feel welcome! Thank you..!! Our waiter Mark Anthony took full control on what we ordered, what a great decision it was and what a valuable asset to the restaurant he is! All other staff were extremely attentive and helpful. We will CERTAINLY be back soon! thanks for a great night!! One of the best restaurants in Singapore!!

Very cozy and nice atmosphere. But beef steak was so salty and lobster roll cost me 26 bucks only for tiny small 2 pieces. If i get there, i wouldn't buy those above foods. It was on average i suppose.

Exceptional food quality and certainly a great place for meat lovers. The homemade bread selection (something I pay a lot of attention too as it is the first indication of a great restaurant) was outstanding. The salad with avocado, blue cheese and Champagne Vinaigrette was extremely refreshing. Hardly anything beats a great, perfectly cooked and flavorful steak but when you get served French purple grape mustard with it, you're in heaven. The service has made my experience finally a remarkable one....very friendly, efficient and experienced. The only point that needs improvement is the light in the back area of the restaurant, it is a touch too dark. Would definitely return.

I was disappointed with the food. I wanted the edges of the steak to have some crispiness on the fat, but it was soggy. I expected to beef to have a rich complex flavor like Morton's, but it just tasted like a regular piece of meat. The flavor combinations of the recipes were very traditional/predictable, which is good, but it meant that the celebrity chef's creativity couldn't rescue the poor execution. The table wasn't leveled on the floor and kept rocking when somebody would lean on the table. We arrived very hungry when the restaurant opened, but the servers were so oriented toward getting lots of tables started that they paid no attention to the tables they already had. We wanted to get drinks and order appetizers quickly, but we couldn't get any service beyond menus and water for more than 20 minutes of our stay. It was surreal to be raising our hands and signaling for service while a dozen servers scurried around the room without looking. Overall the servers were extremely polite, to the point of being obsequious, but they didn't actually DO anything besides brown-nose and follow a robotic routine. They came at certain intervals to check on us and to refill water, but unfortunately those appearances turned out to be exactly the opposite of when we needed a server. When our glasses were empty, nobody came. We signaled, nobody saw us. When we were deep in an important conversation, they interrupted us to give a speech about beef cuts. The staff give memorized speeches about the food, but when we asked questions, it was clear they didn't know anything that wasn't in the speech.

Just popped in for a quick snack and a beer at the Bar and had a great time. Whilst the Country Pƒt‚ was very nice, maybe less bread/brioche would be appreciated as it was way too much to accompany the dish. The Bar staff was exceptionally friendly and gave me a nice portion of freshly baked Lemon Madeleines (they were fantastic!) as a gift to go. This is the kind of touch that make customers return. Thanks so much.

Was there twice. Lunch was affordable ESP for the great views and "boast factor". If you want to experience, go for lunch first. Dinner had great night lights, but can get pricey ESP if u do wine pairing. But, with higher price, you get better service. Chef even came to the table and he was most hospitable. Food was great in taste and presentation. Keep for occasions!

Having taken our Australian friends out to a variety of places around Singapore, they wanted to return the favour in the hotel they were staying - Marina Bay Sands. They visited Singapore for three and a half days and we worked out that Saturday lunch was the best time for us all to go out. After considerable discussion about which venue to choose, Sky on 57 was chosen because of the ability to enjoy air con while having lunch but being able to take in the view after lunch on top of MBS. We arrived at around 12.45 and started things off with a drink at Ce La Vie. The option of air con was justified as the drink outside, while lovely, was pretty hot. Once we finished our drink and taken in the views of the City we moved to the restaurant. For reasons only known to the venue (they only let people staying in the hotel access the entire 57th floor - our friends had checked out so didn't have their access cards, probably because of crowds of people trying to get into the Infinity Pool), we had to go down to the ground floor in tower 3 walk through the atrium to tower 1 and back up the elevator to the restaurant. Not a big problem, in fact it's definitely a first world problem, but worth mentioning. Once in the restaurant, the feeling of light and space encapsulated us despite the restaurant being 80% full. We decided to go for the Business Luncheon option where you get a number of options for Starter, Soup, Main Course and Dessert. Ironically, the ladies went for three courses, they didn't have the soup and the men went for four courses. The ladies each ordered the same and the men likewise. I enjoyed JQ's Signature Starter, a Foie Gras Ziao Long Bao - it was sensational. It consisted of 5 dumplings and both wives enjoyed one as the men were exclaiming how delicious they were. For the soup course, I had Jerusalem Artichoke Veloute containing a blue swimmer crab - again, it was delicious. For main I selected the Maori Lakes Lamb Rack which came with tasty spices, chickpea stew and tamarind jus. This was very nice but if one ranked it with the first two dishes, it would be slightly below. For desert I had the Reconstructed Black Forest. Again, this was nice, a little small perhaps but the ladies had "Paris-Brest", a hazelnut cream, chocolate disc with lulo sorbet. This time the men got a taste and we agreed, this was nicer that what we had. The surprising thing about our lunch was the cost. I would have expected it to be at least $100 per head given the venue but with three courses costing $55 and four being $65, it is great value. Be warned, men have to wear long pants and closed shoes but given its in air conditioned comfort, this isn't an issue. Also, the air con is not too cold which is something we've found in some other places. After lunch, which was around 4 pm, we strolled out onto the deck and took in the views of the City and East Coast. The views were amazing and all in all, it was a perfect afternoon. I should also mention the coffee - I am pretty particular about my coffee and ordered my usual picollo latte. What was provided was very good and on par with most of what I enjoyed back in Australia.

Had a wonderful time at CUT by Wolfgang Puck. The food was exceptional, but credits goes to Marilou for making the evening especially memorable for us as she surprised us with birthday treats for me and my girl!
Good service. Burgers are of fine quality. my favourite is however the dessert - Durian Souffl‚. Love it!!
excellent pizza albeit a little expensive .... $ 40 Sing pizza and cola, but absolutely in line for the city standards.
Our 2nd visit. Brought our overseas friends for lunch. The us couple Truly enjoyed both the food & ambience. Will be back for more.

Located at the entrance of Tower 1 side of the infinity pool. Here you can enjoy a quiet drink to the C'e la vi on the reverse side is the club of. Marina side, there is also outside seating either Gardens by the Bay side, view each is the best.
located inside marina bay with good quality food and the ambiance is amazing yo chill with friends , for a date or a meeting place I highly recommend it thumbs up
The kitchen is a nice place in Singapore at Marina Bay Sands. The food was definitely not top. Nice to have been there, but culinary there is much more and better located in Singapore.

Have been going since they opened. Consistent standard of food and service. Just a great place for simple food does very well. Tried just about everything on the menu - all good. Nice also to be recognised 'as we usually' just do a 'walk in' in the late afternoon.

Review Title/URL: "D‚tente du soir plut“t moyen trŠs d‚‡ue -"
Review: I wanted to enjoy myself in a good restaurant only because I am on a business trip A glass of wine a flat Desert .. Well no! 1st floor level is returned sup me that. 3 people before me had not booked and there was room --but I was alone can not be profitable to block a table! And I find myself at the bar where they promise me to place me that there is a table - so ever! Except again for a table of 4 arrived after me! And when paying the bill the card remains in a box without conceding me and almost 10 minutes !! Suffice to say that i am from sunrise to pick her up .. I was worried !!! at checkout the young woman looks at me like I had never given card / completely cold does not apologize totally inexperienced person - talking about the blue CARD !! It took 3 people to find her., So much that my too liquid Rather risotto risotto soup that went diagonally malgres but all tasteful risotto potage- 1, / 1 glass of wine = 52 euros .., very disappointed and I'm not usually complainer when it's good I do not look at the price

The pizzas are amazing !!! The best pizza that i have ever tried I carve it all the time. Considering the price in Singapore this place is very reasonable. I highly recommend you try it when you are visiting Singapore.

Went with a group of 5. Service was friendly and very efficient. Food was excellent. 6 course tasting menu with wine pairings was very good. Mushroom soup cappuccino roast pig and black cod all excellent.

This place offers an unmatched view overlooking some of the best areas in Singapore. The ambiance and the staff are very nice. Our hostess was extremely friendly and helpful. The food and drinks are very nice. Do try their cocktails.

Review Title/URL: "Nice Pizza Service a bit too efficient"
Review: We had no reservation but they managed to find us some seats at the bar which was nice. Our waitstaff were very efficient to the point of giving us the feeling that we were being encouraged to hurry up and eat and get out of there so they could get the next customers in. This is not to criticize the waitstaff as they were, as said, incredibly attentive but could dial it down a notch to make the experience more enjoyable. The wood fired pizzas were nice. I can see why people rate it highly but in Oz we have been spoilt with many great wood fired pizza restaurants for years so for us was just a nice enough meal at a reasonable price for the location i.e. in the Marina Bay Sands complex. If you are craving wood fired pizza in Singapore you should be satisfied by the offerings of this place.

My friend who invited me up to try her awesome dessert. Went up with one of my hongkong friend up to visit her, had the seats outdoor, it will be slightly humid due to Singapore's weather. But do indulge and enjoy the scenery.

We had an evening meal booked for us here. So we were dropped off by our guide and went to the top floor. The views are breath taking. If you get a table around the out side of the restaurant you will have great views over Singapore. We found the food exceptional, served professionally by the very attentive staff. We were not rushed and they called our private car when we were ready. Would certainly recommend to all to eat at least once here when you are in Singapore

Review Title/URL: "Great restaurant at the top of the hotel"
Review: We had a late dinner without advance reservation but managed to get a table - luckily! The restaurant was a nice surprise as we didn't had read anything about this restaurant beforehand. The food was tasty and I ate the best chocolate dessert ever!!! It was perfect with chocolate, coffee, hints of salt etc. And that is a lot to say as I have eaten quite many chocolate desserts during my life :D
The place looks casual on the upper and posh on lower floor. The food is okay. Not blowing my mind kind of thing. The ambience is good in the upper floor since we got to sit facing the outdoor.

I had to from Asia expansion of shops and a guide book of Wolfgang I went. Looking at the menu there is a little difference and to ask the steak of Japan, ordinary people and ask one person per steak because the greater the amount of meat will leave. It is recommended so you especially from the first two of the dishes and get to share one steak two people. You can choose the Ready-To-Eat steak of the side, but I is recommended macaroni cheese. Was enough satisfaction (which is also significant was the amount) of bread to share a light appetizer 2 dishes because the stick in the service steak one article to share two people. Service is also good personnel gave us service a cup of soft drink to us. Also is a shop that steak I want delicious also go.

My husband and I were staying at the Marina Bay Sands for our honeymoon in April and visited DB Bistro for brunch. We had a lazy morning and were looking for something close by and DB Bistro was perfect. Being connected to the hotel via the mall it was super easy to get to and a perfect choice. I opted for my favourite brunch menu 'Eggs Benedict' with a Mimosa and my husband had the burger. I have to say that it was probably one of the best Eggs Benedict I have ever had! both of us could not have loved our brunch more!

Review Title/URL: "Best pizza in town, or any town."
Review: Had a sit down meal here and it was awesome, the pizzas are amazing, traditional Italian flavours cooked in a huge pizza oven. The service was great and the staff were very polite and friendly. Wasn't expecting much when I walked in but I was amazed at how good it was, really is a hidden gem. The place is a must for any visitor to Singapore.
Awesome mussels and pasta. Incredible meal. Must have. Service is good. Ambience nice and the quality of the food is bloody world class. End of discussion
We had a press luncheon event at the restaurant on 11 May'16 and all our guests and staff loves the meal, services, environment and the fantastic view at Sky on 57! No negative comments at all... :)

The staff are brilliant, the food amazing, the veal tartar was incredible. such a great meal. Only thing is toward the end of the night, the staff kind of forgot about us as the only people outside...

We stopped here on a whim after walking through the shopping mall. We ordered our meals and cocktails which were delicious. There was a mix up with my order however the staff and service despite this was impeccable. My partner and I have an easy going nature and were understanding of the mix up. From our point of view the staff made up for the error in more ways than one which made our night more enjoyable.

This is my second visit to Bread Street and I must say that all the dishes that we have ordered were quite good so far. Especially liked the duck breast that we ordered and the chocolate fondant. Only drawback was that it is always crowded (was there on weekend) and I advise to make your reservations way ahead if you do not want to end up sitting at the bar like we did. We also overheard a party of 6 who had made reservations beforehand were told to sit at the bar area. So please state clearly when you make reservations that you want to be seated at the dining area.

If you'd like to savor some authentic Italian food in Singapore the Mozza is definitely a go-to place. I tried the prosciutto and mozzarella for starter and the prosciutto and rucola pizza as main and did not regret it. It tasted awesome and I could have eaten more of it. Service was good and friendly as well even though it was super busy when I went there. All in all, Mozza is a safe bet for all admirers of Italian food.

Review Title/URL: "An unfortiuante start turned around in spectacular fashion"
Review: I don?t write many reviews, in fact this is my second ever? but I just wanted to take the time to do so as Michael and his team did an exceptional job at turning around what was an unfortunate booking error. We had a reservation for 2:30 on Mother?s Day so we arrived looking forward to a long leisurely afternoon dining experience. Unfortunately there had been an error and we were informed that the restaurant was closing and we would therefore not be able to have lunch (although we had the option of dining in the more relaxed area outside ? but this doesn?t have aircon and is not what we had in mind in any case). Unfortunately the front desk (not sure if this is part of Spargo or a shared service with the hotel) were rather inflexible and the attitude was unfortunately that this was our fault. At any rate, a small amount of escalation later to the right level of management not only we were given a number of complementary dishes / drinks (all of which are covered here in other reviews and are indeed delicious) but we were also allowed into the (now closed) restaurant to continue our meal. I must say the complementary dishes & drinks were much appreciated ? who doesn?t like that ? but what most impressed me was the level of service that Michael and the team gave to us during the whole experience. I can safely say that this is cemented in my memory as one of the best, if not the best dining experience I have had in Singapore. Thanks to Spago ? we will be back... and your restaurant is also now number 1 on my client entertainment list !

Initially, we were a bit put off. We had arrived about 3 minutes before Adrift opened for lunch and we were told to take a walk in the lobby. It was a sweltering day and we just wanted to sit, but the hostess refused to let us wait at table for the few minutes before they actually opened. We had to demand to see a manager and by the time our hostess walked off to find one, the restaurant was opened and a waitress arrived to seat us. Needless to say, this did not set the right mood for a relaxing brunch. While the food wasn't bad and the ambience and actual meal service was good, Adrift still has a way to go before they reach the kind of service one would expect in a five star hotel.
Pizza tastes fine and conveniently visit while staying at the Marina Bay was great in can. good.,

Review Title/URL: "This is not your normal Italian Restaurant "
Review: This place offers unique and special Italian food. I went there with my wife and ordered three appetizers and two pastas. Both of us have the same comments - delicious, unique and authentic. Something that you will not get in your normal Italian Restaurant. We were seated at the bar as they did not have a table for us. The bar tender is very friendly and best of all not "pushy". Surprisingly, the prices of the food here are not as steep as compared to other restaurants in Marina Bay. I will definitely want to visit it again and try other dishes.
I'm a neighbor in Marina Bay. Information reported immediately went to inquire too large. Were also squeezed price was fine.
For dinner Cute and courteous service and extremely tasty dishes Whether japanese chinese or boarding dishes everything tastes freshly prepared and with the look a great location

Treated my husband to the Rise buffet last night. Wooow! The selection is incredible. Efficient and friendly service too. I was surprised to see Yalumba wine as part of the selection. Not a fan lol way better Aussie wines than that so I tried the USA chardy instead. Drinks are expensive but that is expected as alcohol isnt cheap in Singapore. Thanks for a beautiful dinner!

We came here especially because of the Gordon Ramsey name. Unfortunately it didn't live up to our expectations at all. The food was under seasoned and under whelming. My scallops entree was tasteless and my partners carpaccio was over cooked. The blackened cod main was bland and gelatinous, the skin was undercooked and slimey. However the duck was really nice and well cooked. Really came for the experience and wouldn't return!

Ordered the steak and ale pie- thinking at $38 it would be sensational! Piece of frozen pastry over a pot of stew. Friend had the fish n chips- fish decent but frozen chips- good service-but suggest GR does a reality show-going round to his own restaurants- showing them how to cook!
Fish n chips were ok. For the price expecting homemade chips rather bought in frozen. It's those little touches that make it a 3 star not 5 star. Worth a visit.

Went there twice, once lunch once dinner. The food is overall good but I would think lack of a wow factor. I tried their pork chop, pork belly, steak and some other dishes?overall nice but I feel lack of the wow dishes that make me want to go back again. I mean I will certainly go there as I do like that place just no particular food craving to lure me back frequently. Overall also a bit expensive.

Review Title/URL: "Great food! Try the weekend breakfast menu"
Review: Have been dining here with my family and friends. Nice egg Benedict and usual main course BSK burger. Have some selection of kids menu and nice dessert. Would recommend to all. Would suggest to make early reservation especially very peak on weekend.

It was my first visit and it was a pleasant experience. I went there before a show at the Sands Theatre (which is right opposite the restaurant. Before we were brought to our table, the thoughtful staff asked if we were catching a show. We tried the 2-course Pre-Theatre Set Dinner and we had the Salmon and Coq Au Vin Blanc as the mains. They were both superb and the service was great. At the end of the meal, we were just in time for the 7:30pm show.
Dinner at Sky of 57 is a memorable experience to say the least. The food was fantastic. I cannot do this review justice. This is a must for a special occasion. Service was impeccable.

Not to have risks we chose the chef's tasting menu at $ 250 per person price. For the price which is expected to be really surprised. The menu was good, tasty dishes, but no big surprise, some taste really different to be worth the price paid. With this value you can dine in the best restaurants in the world and this was not level. The service is impeccable and the view is beautiful. If the price was 1/3 win footnote 5, but charge expensive needs to deliver more.

My first night in Singapore & decided to grab a quick dinner at Adrift. Ordered the cheese burger which was the best burger I've had in a long time. The wait or brought over free crisps to begin with which was great. The service here is outstanding, and the Singapore slings are great. As we were staying at marina bay sands hotel we did get 30% off the bill - as long as it was charged to the room. Definitely recommend this place!

Fabulous pizzas in a cute and relaxed setting. If you like your pizza sauce intense, this is the place to come! Good quality ingredients paired with great service, all in all a fab relaxed place to eat. Can't wait to go back :)

Review Title/URL: "Beautiful setting, fab drinks, let down only by less than acceptable service."
Review: Such a great lounge, such a beautiful chilled out and high end vibe, and so much better than it's neighbour Ce La Vie. Shame only about the service, which is quite sad. It was impossible to get a waiter to look at us even to get a glass of water. Eventually we had to get up and ask at the bar ourselves.

I booked the table more than one month before and i stated i preferred table with nice view and sure enough i got it! the service is above average staff is friendly. The complimentary assorted bread is nice with the butter. we finished everything. The salmon ceviche is good and really serves its purpose of "appetiser", the acidity kind of make the enzyme in your mouth and stomach start to secrete. The 380g of ribeyes is a killer, she had it with blue cheese sauce, she told me it was heaven. I was having the dingley dell pork belly with spiced apple puree. the pork belly was done right with crispy skin and soft flesh. the proportion of layers of fat and lean was right too. The slightly sweet apple puree complements the savoury pork well. Mac n cheese is very tasty and i must warn you it is super filling too. the cheese may stick in your stomach for hours. don't bother to order the seasonal green. not with the 10 bucks. one more tip, get your complimentary ticket when you pay your bill. easily save your 20 bucks.

We ate here as part of a one-day stay at Marina Bay Sands for dinner. First, we found it convenient to after spending the evening at the legendary pool that closes at 23:00. Man sitting in the hotel, but this is not disturbing Hall - we had a cozy place. The service is very attentive. My lobster on the plate was immediately noticed and taken the appropriate cutlery immediately, always refilled water, cleared plates. At meals there was everything you could want in extremely fresh quality and visually well presented. Incredibly besides the choice of mussels, oysters and lobster is the selection of different breads and desserts - Incredibly delicious sorbet varieties and pies. Especially delicious and pomegranate salad.

We went with high expectations, Gordon Ramsay's business being to give failing restaurants advice, but it wasn't quite up to par. The shepherd's pie was quite good, but that was about it - the drinks we ordered were very mediocre and the desserts were very average as well. The ambiance was nice but you would expect a lot more from this establishment.

Lovely location with outdoor seating next to the water with great views and good service. Ideally located if you are going to Gardens by the Bay. Fantastic that they also have bike racks so you can stop by after Cycling. Love that they are open for breakfast at 7.30am at the weekends. This is well priced and there are a range of options. One of our orders was poached eggs on avocado with toast (homemade pumpernickel bread). Delicious and very nicely presented. They were also very helpful in doing an yummy side salad. Sadly, our other order, the Full English Breakfast was disappointing and it didn't feel like it was off the same menu. The poached eggs, sausage, bacon, tomato and mushroom were all cooked perfectly. However, the tinned baked beans and sliced white factory made bread let this meal down. It wouldn't have taken much to elevate this dish to what we would have expected from a Gordon Ramsay establishment. In our opinion, all it needed was some good quality bread (such as the pumpernickel, a sourdough or something more rustic) and maybe some homemade baked beans (check out the homemade baked beans at Common Man Coffee Roasters - a great breakfast spot in Singapore). Not drastic changes but something to make this breakfast a little less ordinary and be closer to the competition. Also worth noting is that the coffee was average. Room for improvement! Bread Street: please keep this early weekend breakfast. It would just be great if you could make a few adjustments. Hope this makes sense. We hope to be back soon!

Good food. Well done and with quality, but the prices are high and the wines very high for a "Bistro". Probably Singapore prices, but anyway is expensive for what you get. Nice place to be at night with good company
Lovely location, great view.Food not good, steak pie more pastry than meat.The fish overcooked, overpriced for what you get, definitely not worth it.

Maybe its just the way Singaporw is but the staff here is incredibly bad. The menu is basically just pizzas which although are pretty good but the whole dining experience was a let down due to the poor service. The pizzas came quick but when we tried to order more pizzas they would just deny saying you should have ordered eaelier as now its difficult to keep your table occupied to serve you another pizza. Are you frikkin joking? And I thought this was a Michelin Starred chef restaurant. They forgot our lemonades and when we reminded them of it, "its almost the end of your meal and it would take me another 20 minutes to get it,would you rather cancel the order" So yep,would not recommend to dine here if you don't want to spoil your mood and pay for expensive food.
Must visit but watch the prices .... $ 24 singapore for a standing cocktail (since often the tables are occupied)

Went with friends in evening. Very welcoming and top end decorations. Very comfortable and relaxing ambience. Lots of choices in menu. Waiters were very helpful with menu and selecting dishes. Food were beautifully presented and delicious. Definitely go back again.

Review Title/URL: "One of a must-try eateries once you are in SG"
Review: The eatery is very popular. It is very difficult to get a seat for walk-ins. So reservation is recommended. The food is good but a bit pricey since it belongs to the TV-show chef, Gordon Ramsay. Still worth trying his food. After the meal, you will be served with home made cookies in the jar. If you are not hungry, you still can enjoy the drinks or cocktails there.

Pros: - Lovely atmosphere - Manager and staff were pleasant - Bread with butter was excellent Cons: - Food was average - Overpriced for a bristo I would recommend to pay a visit at least but will not be back again.
it is expensive but in fairness, I think you get what you pay for. We go on special occasions and are always impressed with the food, cocktails and service generally.
The home is pleasant, it helps to better digest not exceptional pizza and totally overpriced in a too noisy environment.

Due to some coincidence, I was there for a weekend brunch, followed by a weekday dinner within a few days. The service at dinner is exceptional with the cheery wait staff checking in on us in between dishes and never failed to top up our water and replace used utensils promptly. The food at brunch tasted great! My companions and I ordered their business set lunches and seasonal set lunch. I had tuna for starters and Sakura chicken with ginseng as mains; I was startled at how flavourful the food was. Food at dinner was slightly more disappointing. Our Maine lobster and penne duck confit veered towards the saltish end. But in all, both experiences are great and I would recommend this place for special occasions for friends and families, on the strength of their exceptional service.

Food, atmosphere, service... and, of course, the view! I had to take my team (working a booth at the Marina Bay Sands convention center) out to dinner. I asked the concierge my hotel (the Pan Pacific) for a recommendation -- one American (me, a vegetarian), two Swedes, and two Japanese -- preferably something not Asian. She recommended Sky on 57, made the reservations for me, and informed them that I was a veg'n. When we arrived, directly from the convention center, they took all of our laptop bags (checked them at the hostess desk, essentially), seated us, presented me with a separate menu, took our order, and then escorted us outside so we could watch (from above) the light show in Gardens by the Bay, the Supertrees. Service from everyone was over above expectations. Perfectly brilliant. The food was absolutely fantastic and everyone was pleased and very impressed (we all ordered starters and a main). No one ordered dessert, as we were stuffed to the top! This was a lovely and fabulous dining experience and I definitely recommend!

We visited for drinks to celebrate my 60 Th birthday. Great service views to die for and all made very special by the welcoming Assistant Manager Aztol Ishak who was very kind and made my birthday special. Thank you so much.

What a beautiful, relaxing and chilling location. Spacious is located on 57th floor on Marina Bay Sands, which guarantees a superb view over both the marina Bay and the marina Bay Gardens. Very good cocktails - try Peace on Earth. Service lacks a bit. Expensive!!!

Have now celebrated two birthdays at Spago and will return. The fish items, the Pan Seared Red Snapper Laksa and Honey Miso Broiled Black Cod were standouts. Also not to be missed, is their signature dish, the Big Eye Tuna Tartare Cones - a taste sensation. Loved the atmosphere - well spaced large tables, bright and breezy interior and well trained and friendly staff. Great cocktails at the bar and well worth a visit prior to dinner.
Great snacks, especially the tuna tartare and foie gras tart, are spectacular. Great service and lounge environment is nota 10!
For those seeking a quality buffet with sashimi, French cheeses and great desserts worth the visit. It is in the hotel lounge.
Original and cozy deco, impeccable service and welcome, tasty dishes a little fusion trend but not very rich though. very decent wines. Ideal for a business dinner.

Came on a Sunday noon for brunh and the restaurant was packed. We were told we would be seated at the bar and after 15 minutes of waiting time we were showed to a window seat with hot sun shining directly onto. They got decent aircond so well.. It took a while to get the attention of a server and when the food finally came, the omelet was average. Though they did serve amazing Scotch Eggs. Service was slow, no one would refill the water and it was hard to even get someone to hand us the check. The restaurant was considered good in overall but we won't come back again.
perfect food! The waitress Regina !! We attended more than good! And we got our complimentary cake for our honeymoon! Perfect!

I went here with my partner and two friends in December and we were all very disappointed. The $30 meal we ordered was actually just a taster and the full meal was double the price, we would not have minded if the food had been nice but it was sadly extremely average. The service was nothing to shout about and after spending $500 we definitely didn't feel well looked after. It's just a gimmick, save your money for somewhere else!

The crust they use in their pizzas is very different and it was delicious! We got a white pizza and a regular pizza and both were amazing. However Marina Bay is a bit far from everything so I wouldn't say its necessarily worth driving here but if you are shopping or in the area then go by.

In a sleek setting almost too tables are installed near the windows overlooking views of the Bay and the Singapore Strait. The reception is a little but agreed most friendly service while remaining very professional. We had a tasting menu with 6 dishes and wines in agreement. dressage flavors and presentation are outstanding. Very unusual sensations. The downside for wines but originality effort is attempted. And I'm hard on this.
The Marina Bay area is one of the must see places in Singapore. For a panoramic view Sky on 57 simply gives you the best views so go there to take in the view and for great pics.

Having wanted to try this joint since it opened in Singapore, my friend and I finally made reservations for dinner. We got a table by the side of the restaurant facing the waters and landscape which was magnificent. The only drawback is that passers-by will ALWAYS stare at what's on your table. The food was generally good but the prices were hefty. The bread basket is refillable. Appetisers: Alaskan king crab - disappointing as it wasn't very tasty, lacking seasoning almost Seared scallops - while everything on the plate went well together, the tiny pieces just didn't satisfy Mains: Butternut squash risotto - the best risotto I've eaten thus far in Singapore! Roasted lamb - bloody good BUT they were so skinny, not worth the price Sides: Coleslaw - the most delicious coleslaw I've had in my lifetime! A must have! Onion rings - beautifully golden and crisp rings! Yum! Desserts: Chocolate fondant - a chocolate lover's perfect end to a meal! BSK chocolate and peanut bar - this is just a different way of presenting a Snickers or Mars bar; not terrible but nothing fantastic either Worth a try.

we went here both for lunch and dinner, the food was delicious and enough choice. the location is perfectly nice and central and has a brilliant view over the water. service staff was very correct so all combined a real treat and would definitely advice everyone to go !
Excellent food... reasonable price and quality service...good location.. Long story short... just perfect!!!
As in all big cities in Singapore also has spectacular views of this bar, not to be missed! Recommended as a cocktail Singapore Sling

Went to Spago on 19/05/2016 for my birthday. A big shoutout to Captain Catalin, who made our night special! He provides great recommendations on the food, and the food were very nice! His service was fantastic too, taking care of us & very humorous. Must try - duck breast, tuna tartare cones, kaya toast, hamachi & warm octopus salad. Their dessert is not so fantastic, a little too sweet for me. Especially the caramel.

We have long wanted to check this place out and the first opportunity we got, we decided to book for a table for two.
