And the drinks are not cheap (large beer + lemonade = 35 $ !!) but you get a bowl of peanuts !! Once ordered Jeje consumption, you can move freely across the roof as long as you want. It is a must !!

Review Title/URL: "Drinking at the Side of the most famous Pool or the World"
Review: The infinity pool at Marina Bay Sands Hotel may only be used by hotel guests, but you can enjoy a drink right next door at Spago, overlooking the pool and the city?s skyline. The open bar reminds one very much of a terrace at a cozy cottage. It is open to all sides and equipped with comfortable sofas and flat tables. However, you don?t necessarily have to watch the mermaids splashing around as from the other side of terrace you have a fantastic view over the Marina Bay. Those who wish, may also have a little chitchat at the bar. When we went, we only tried the cocktails, which were truly delicious. We did take a glance at the food menu and it all sounds great. Next time we go, we will definitely have a bite.
Beautiful restaurant. Nicer when dimmer. Good buzz. Food is delicious, small though. Prefer when restaurant is more full.
Great restaurant within the marina bay shopping mall. A very high standard of food at a fraction of the price. Very helpful and courteous staff

Was so excited to try out this restaurant opened by G.Ramsay (my hubby's fav chef). However, we were pretty disappointed with the food. The mains we had were below average standard from what we could get elsewhere at quarter of the price. Interestingly, the complimentary bread basket was very very good. Service was excellent! And the view of the marina bay was awesome.
Can't fault this restaurant. Excellent service, food and location. It surpassed all of my expectations! Must visit for a meal out in Singapore. Highly recommend.

Hotel Concierge booked here to shop in the seafood of delicious store of request. Oysters of ask a platter of oysters and three types (by locality) came out. Other You can enjoy seafood that meets the white wine, such as shrimp. In addition, we asked also steak which also was able to enjoy fit in red wine.

Review Title/URL: Walked in without reservation on a Sunday - excellent starters
Review: Walked in without a reservation on a Sunday in August. It was really busy and the service was a little bit slow. I had two starters instead of a pizza. I had the oven baked asparagus with prosciutto and parmesan and the arancini di riso alla bolognese. Both delicious. The pizzas looked good, I just wasn't in the mood for a pizza. The toilets there were very nice and clean.

This is the 5th time I have visited the restaurant and none of the staff remembers or have a record of me. This is not important. I reserved the restaurant for a table of 5 on 12th August mentioning that I am celebrating my son's 17th birthday. Both my teenage sons are dressed smartly with shoes and shirt albeit wearing a pair of Bermudas in hot Singapore. We were immediately ushered aside and were told that my 2 sons were not appropriately dressed and has to be in long pants. The waitress quickly went to the cloak room and appeared with 2 pair of black pants and insisted that the kids put on the pants. I told the waitress that the dress code stated smart casual and did not insist on long pants and asked them to check with the managers. The waitress insisted that the managers wants the boys to put on long pants. The Manager should at least come out to talk to us but no they are not bothered with our business. We left the restaurant feeling insulted. The only reason I came back for 5 times was because I supported Justin Quek but this one time totally spoil the whole experience. I won't bother with a restaurant who doesn't value their customers. In this hard F&B times I am surprise that such kind of snobbish attitude still exist! No wonder I've never seen the restaurant filled before besides the high price.
The terrace is beautiful for drinks and showing overseas guests the views in Singapore. Food inside restaurant is ok. Not consistent. Would come when I have guests in town.

Incredible evening at Sky on 57! What a view and with a meal to match! Fantastic food - pricey but definitely get what you pay for. Staff were wonderful - very attentive but not over the top. A must do in Singapore!

Review Title/URL: Love this restaurant but not the logistics
Review: One of my favourite restaurant but the logistics of going up is very unpleasant taking the same lift with hotel guests who are still wet from the pool or wearing slippers and towels when the restaurant guests are nicely dressed.

The main goal was to try out chef Ramsay's food, knowing that his food concept relies on pretty simple dishes with the use of high quality products and a bit of local flare. The restaurant atmosphere and upscale urban design immediately set up the mood for a good brunch time and waiters provided a simple yet prompt and friendly service. The menu had good selection of each course, including healthy options. We went for a lighter dishes like salads and eggs. Watermelon salad was very refreshing and the main - roasted cod with artichokes and potatoes was soft and tangy. The other two egg dishes were very nice as well; especially the one with poached eggs and avocado on a slice of pumpernickel bread. The juices were also fresh and tasty. One of the cutest things is upon receiving the bill, they place a jar of homemade cookies at your table that were delicious. We were really happy that we ended up having lunch here!

Advise you to book very popular ,table for two pleasant environment, nice ambience attentive staff wine rather expensive but hey ho ,the fish dinner and duck breast never tasted anything so divine could not fault it, if could go back and back again.!!!!

Great atmosphere, very friendly staff and a great management! The restaurant was packed to overflowing, we could hardly find a place at the bar. For risotto and cocktail paid SGD $ 55. Value for money and the service provided!

Went with friends for a dinner before the show. Service is very professional and reminds me of those premium restaurants in the US. They could be a little more genuine, though. Otherwise, it will all feel so pretentious. CUT's setting is rather dark, very modern --- it feels a lot like dinner clubs in NYC. All in all, nice place to hang-out after work with friends or colleagues. Kids or family? Maybe not so. We ordered bigeye tuna tartare and the Alaskan King Crab and Shrimp Louis as appetizers. Both are nicely cooked, but my preference is the Louis because of the spicy tomato-horseradish sauce. My main course is the 100% Wagyu Hokkaido Snow Beef filet mignon. Taste very nice, and luckily I ordered the filet mignon which is only 120g. Too big portion of wagyu/kobe/matsuzaka beef usually make you feel stuffy very quickly. Smaller size means just nice. Too excited to eat this until I forgot to take picture of the beef! Net, this is a good place to go for premium beef if you don't care about the price. Price is rather steep --- $250 for the beef and $22-41 for each appetizer dish, before GST and service charge. This is why I always cherish my visit to Steak House Satou in Kichijoji --- much better value!

My wife and I were very excited to eat at DB Bistro after enjoying their food at the recent MBS Food and Wine show last weekend. It was a complete disappointment. Food was lacked flavour and was underseasoned, and really didn't justify the incredibly expensive prices. Wine list was very good, and service great too. Just really disappointing food, especially after how much we enjoyed their stand at the Food & Wine show. Definitely won't be going back - sorry DB Bistro!

On the way to the famous infinity pool for an early morning swim on top of the hotel we passed the desk for Spagos ( they were open for breakfast) and spontaneously booked for dinner. Dressed for dinner we ventured forth for dinner at the top of the town. Words fail me Service impeccable View of Singapore spectacular. Food fantastic. Entree of choice were hand made brandy snaps formed into cones containing fish and wonderful seasoned meat. Steak tartare was on offer and was delicious. Roast duck was succulent and cooked to perfection crispy on the outside pink on the inside. Angry lobster screamed try me and did not disappoint. Spicy whole maine lobster was presented in the shell and the waiter requested permission to prepare the lobster and expertly removed the tender meat from the shell. The performance enchancing the occassion. Finish with two cheeses choosen from an impressive cheese board they we tasty and quality. Just to be different souffle was the dessert I chose. Our waiter advised that the chef had rejected the souffle that had been prepared and would make a new souffle and this would take about 20 minutes. No problem on holiday glass of wine in hand and a million dollar view the time flew by. Mentioned to the waiter the everything had been terrific and could he pass my compliments the chef I was surprised were the chef came to table we were ableto thank her personally for making the night a success. The night was not cheap but was worth every cent and is plsce revisit.

Staying in the hotel we allow a brunch from 88 $ Singapore excluding drink, a little expensive at the thought but once I saw the buffet we were really happy, fresh fish cooked, raw, seasoned, natural at will, meats, cheeses, selection of breads, fruit salads and in addition a dish is a sweet choice of freshly prepared from the kitchen. We ate some great eggs benedict and two spectacular desserts! What can I say let groped :-)

Review Title/URL: Very good dinner before light show
Review: Really chose here because it was close to the light show and we love Ramsay and the few other of his restaurants we have been too. By reading about here it sounded like a modern cafe, it may be by day but at night it does turn into quite a classy dining spot. We were not quite dressed for here (singlet and shorts) but had no issue getting in. We had a fair few dishes from entrees, mains and desserts. Thinking back I can not fault any and everything was really good. Service was great although would have been great if a tad faster, but that was maybe because we were in a bit of a rush. The price, well it may be cheaper than some other places in the area, but it's still not cheap. Between 3 adults and 1 child our bill was $400, did include a couple wines which at $26 a glass is very pricey!!! But that's one of the cheapest on the menu. Still gets 5 stars from us!!

Picked this place as my birthday lunch on a weekday - finally I get to try this place :) Set Lunch at $48 for 3-course was very reasonable I must say. Starter - salmon tartine and fried wanton skins. Refreshing, with an interesting contrast. Mains - braised beef cheeks with mash and veg. Abit too salty for me though, but the beef was very tender. My date had a baked salmon pie and not bad too! Desserts - the baileys creme brulee was good! But the cheese platter was a bit too strong for us. Also ordered an extra salad of avocado, watermelon, and pumpkin seeds. Very tasty! Coffee was nice too. We had a view of the river at street level and it was quite nice. Service was attentive and efficient without being overly intrusive. Didn get the WOW i was looking for, but will definitely want to try dinner here next time!

The special raspberry and lime margarita cocktails here were perfect on a rainy day. And after traveling around Southeast Asia, this food was a treat! We really enjoyed the flatbread with carmelized onion, straccietella cheese, green asparagus and San Daniele ham. It was a bit of a hunt to find it in the immense Marina Bay Sands mall, but we did it, and it was satisfying.

Last year we dined at the restaurant Gordon Ramsay at the Paris Las Vegas and we were delighted. When we heard that there was in Singapore we could not resist and went to dinner. The staff has since proved very helpful finding us a place even though the tables were all reserved. We also requested the Beef Wellington and while not in the menu, the chef accomodated us. It was impeccable. The outline of carrots, broccoli and mashed with truffle shavings was fantastic. Finally we took a pistachio chocolate dome, morello cherry sorbet heavenly. It recommended the restaurant to both the quality of food and for the service (likeable and friendly staff). Before we account the delicious chocolate chip cookie we have been offered. Everything really wonderful.

We came across Osteria Mozza by accident and were lucky to have a table as we have been pretty early. Being from Europe and eating Italian in Singapore, I had rather low expectations but how wrong have I been. Embarrassingly I have to admit that I had the best Burrata I ever had and the pasta was just out of this world and on top of it they knew what al dente is as in a lot of Italian restaurants around the world, they forgot how to cook a proper pasta. So all credit to Osteria Mozza. I could not fault the food, I just wished I left some space for the desert but will do that next time and maybe you could consider to open a Restaurant in London as you would be a fantastic addition to the Italian Restaurant Scene

This place is always full whenever I walked past it, even till late hours. I managed to snag a seat at the side of the restaurant... only thing is that passer-bys like to look at what you are eating! There were too many choices of pizza and finally I settled for the recommended 16 inch Burricotta pizza with peperonata, olives and oregano. It was a bomb with a tangy and herbaceous taste. The soft cheese served as a spread that could well coat each bite I had! The fried pig's ears was a new experience for me. Crispy with a soft interior. Service was prompt and friendly!

Review Title/URL: Great pizza and a glass of red
Review: made reservations from our room at Marina Bay Sands so were seated immediately when we arrived. Goat cheese pizza and Margarita pizza both wonderful the service was with a smile and fast. thanks for a great dinner

Review Title/URL: Ok food but you pay for the venue mostly
Review: I brought my family to lunch there as compensation for not spending time with them for the Mother's Day. By now, my daughter is an expert in Italian pastas and she was not impressed. Too salty was her verdict. The other dishes were all a blur now ...

Review Title/URL: Very good food in a wonderful setting!
Review: Rise occupies a central and fairly sizable position in the Hotel Lobby which has a high atrium. Diners enjoy good comfort as the tables are not too near each other. Buffet offers a wide variety of cooked as well as fresh items. Quality is high, as expected in such a renowned hotel. What impressed us most was the excellent service extended by the staff -- obviously a well-trained and highly professional team!

Buffet restaurant inside the hotel that offers breakfast, lunch and dinner, the food variety is really wide, unfortunately to close around 22, maybe a little pay .. However, here you can find food for every palate. high price.

The venue is run by Justin Quek, a local celebrity chef. The food is not particularly memorable but what strikes me is Justin's temper. When I had dinner there, he got into a heated argument with a customer who complained about how the steak should be prepared. So eat at your own risk ...
It's beautiful, it's good, it's trendy, it's chic, it's okay in price, what more ?? AH, I forgot! Plus the staff is young, sexy and smiling! Good appetite!

Review Title/URL: Is the crazy price for the ingredients or culinary skills or the venue?
Review: After the dinner three months ago, I was still not in a position to answer the question above, because the ingredients are all high-end, the venue is exclusive but the culinary skills? Honestly I can't tell. I can't even recall any memorable dishes any more ...
three of us ordered everything from the steaks to the lamb , side dishes and desserts. I am a difficult eater but cannot find fault with anything that we tasted it was really that good.
great restaurant in the atrium of the marina bay sands towers with a varied sushi and international food, reasonable prices

Rise is one of the best buffet in singapore!!! Elegant place and very appetizing selection of food. From entries to dessert where amazing! Staff are very helpful and accommodating. This is a great place to eat or just have a drink on their very classy lounge.

Review Title/URL: Great selection and awesome dessert buffet
Review: Very good spread of different food selection in a nice comfortable setting on the GF of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Save room for dessert !

The best kind of bar is located on the 57 floor of the Marina Bay, there is also a club. Bar calm, come there in the first place, with the view) Another very tasty cocktails. Prices are high, but in principle, it is Singapore, the low price is not) really enjoyed the stay in the bar, the atmosphere is friendly, romantic)

Creative cuisine of NY style, beautifully also in appearance, is one of the favorite restaurants in Singapore b. In particular, than the course, a la carte are made with care, prices did not feel so high even at high Singapore
Don't think about the view, nothing about it, but think about a good nice place for a perfect cocktail, it's all about passion and the way of making it. Old fashion & Mojito the best in town?Ÿ”?Ÿ

Brought a friend for dinner on 19th August for Chef Ramsey's famous beef wellington. Phillipino female staff at entrance enquired if we had reservations and we said no. We arrived quarter to 7pm - the reply she gave me? I can only let you have the table for 1 HOUR sir! Are you serious?? We couldn't get to eat beef wellington as yet another Caucasian staff that attended to us said we had to pre-order and book 3 DAYS IN ADVANCE! Chef Ramsey are you really serious? To sum it all up, we didn't enjoy the food we ordered. It was a platter for 2. Nothing to brag about it really and plus our mood was already dampened from the moment we entered the restaurant. very bad ventilation, I am disappointed.

Having lived in LA and dined @ Spago during it's go-go days, I was curious to try their Singapore venue perched atop the Marina Bay Sands. Our Firm hosted 32 for drinks (bar) and dinner (private room). The Staff made the evening for us; friendly, attentive, polished and professional. Glasses were kept full, hors d'oeuvres generously passed and arriving guests properly welcomed. The private rooms are light, airy, well-managed and private. Food is solid fare. Wines are nicely-paired. Most-importantly: The staff knows how to choreograph an evening. Not too rushed; never lagging. I'm keen to return for an evening with a smaller group in the large, expansive main dining area. Views are beautiful (as would-be expected) however the noise from the infinity pools is a bit distracting in the evening. Pity, actually. Feels like one is dining at the resort poolside versus at a top-quality Resto.

Set back from the hustle and permanent passage of the great hall of Marina Bay Sands, the Adrift restaurant offers a nice kitchen mixing Asia and California. The bar to entry is pleasant and offers good cocktails. The price for a quality restaurant is more reasonable.

CUT is exactly as you would expect, some of the worlds best steak, great service and a top night. It's not however somewhere to visit if you're on a budget. We ordered the American Wagyu filet minion and rib eye steaks - both were cooked to perfection (as ordered). We added the Mac and Cheese and a spinach dish, which was plenty for two to share. We hadn't bothered with starters as we expected the mains would be enough. All the staff we encountered were friendly and only too willing to help. The wait for food and drinks wasn't long despite it being a busy Saturday night and when they heard we were on part of our Honeymoon they surprised us with a complimentary dessert with a congratulations message. Great meal and great restaurant. Dinner for two with wine and the odd cocktail or two was around s$700. NB - CUT isn't actually in the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, it's located in the Shoppes at Marina Bay opposite - we didn't realise this until we arrived.

I came here to have the famous db burger. I took it as part of a 3 course menu, which started with a tasty corn soup. The db burger itself was a bit of an anti climax: it did not taste good nor bad...it basically tasted neutral. The wines served by the glass were bad average. I do not mind paying large sums of money for food, but then the quality should be outstanding, which is not how I experienced this place. To end with a more positive note: service staff is helpful and friendly. They do their best to give you a good time. They are not to blame for the fact that this brunch fell short of my expectations.

We had a really good time here for lunch today. Had the 3 course lunch and managed to get vegetarian options all of which were delicious and tastefully presented! Regina and Jenny were most helpful with the service and help with ordering. Attention to detail - excellent! Will surely return?Ÿ
It is an ordinary bar with all the standard drinks but by the fact that it is high at 57 is a special experience
Love the service, the food was good, the price is on the high side but it was reasonable for the location itself

Good start with cocktails that are not buried in tons of ice as often. Entries original, excellent meat and generous portions, beautiful surroundings and a friendly and efficient staff. Finally an excellent dessert. The Californian restaurant W Puck in Singapore is a real success in a lively atmosphere.

With so many hotel guests to feed I think the staff here do a wonderful job, I've never seen an omelette made so quickly and it was delicious. The staff are very well organised, extremely helpful and very polite. I really enjoyed my breakfast here.

Sky on 57 could not have been more of a perfect location for my special occasion that I had planned for that day. I booked a reservation online and make a special, quite big, request on the notes of the reservation. Within a few days they had been in contact to set up how I wanted to propose. They presented everything with elegance and significance. I want to thank the Sky 57 staff for the tremendous support of my proposal and to the chef for the desert plate of the signage, "Marry me Andres." After our dinner they had reserved a spot out on the balcony over looking the city and botanical gardens. What a special night it was for proposing to my boyfriend and best friend! Thank you for everything you had done in your range of ability to help make this a special kind of night for Andres and myself. Thank you!

The restaurant is opened by local well known chef Justin Quek. It is located at level 57 with a great view overlooking the garden by the bay. The view would much have the weather been not so hazy. Maybe if that is the case, we would be dining outside and enjoying the view. Today we are having the 3-course restaurant week lunch which costs $40++ per person. We start the meal with the bread basket, served with butter. There are 4 types of bread : cheese, Japanese, baguette and herb. The baguette has quite a hard crust. The cheese one is most yummy to have. The bread is refillable. Starter : Kurobuta Wanton Sauteed prawns, lobster & tomato fondue The overpacked wantons look more like siew mai with filling threatening to come out. It tastes quite flavourful and juicy. Main Course : Sakura Chicken Sauteed mushroom, potato mousseline, Shao Xing wine sauce The dish is fragrant and reminds me of the Herbal Emperor Chicken ????? with its smell. Although served with cream sauce, the sauce is light with asian flavours in it. The chicken is very tender and tears easily from the bone. We also order the resturant's signature JQ's Signature Foie Gras Xiao Long Bao ????? ($25++). The xiao long bao has quite an amount of soup inside. It has the strong flavour of foie gras and truffle in it too. But I feel that the skin of the xiao long bao is a bit too thick. The staff has replied that such thick skin is needed in order to hold the soup. Dessert : JQ's Signature Freshly baked fine apple tart, vanilla ice cream Unlike that the usual apple tart, the thinly sliced apple lies on a thin crispy pastry skin. I like the flakiness of the tart, which is balanced by the ice cream. I am a bit sad that the ice cream melts rather fast, which makes one feels the need to rush through the dish. Overall it has been an enjoyable lunch with JQ asking about the meal. The guy has a great memory of remembering us.

What a fantastic way to start the day, a morning swim in probably the best pool in the world followed by a very nice breakfast. The variety of food is abundant, the service is very good, everyone will greet you with a warm "Good morning" or a nice smile. This is an exceptional place to eat I would thoroughly recommend breakfast here.

I ate sushi at Haneda at the time of departure, I try to eat the oyster, available on the day you arrive in Singapore. And toast with beer, carafe of the then white wine. Oyster and six of the season, salad, such as lamb, which was recommended. I can eat in peace, but wonder if a little high ~.

It is located within the complex of Marina Bay Sands, which is very convenient if you are staying in this hotel. The atmosphere is very well done, and the pizza is simply amazing ... one of the best we've tested. I totally recommend.

We try the business lunch at noon on Saturday, the former dish duck egg dumplings & Spa start, scared to Heaven and delicious words can not describe in words, duck dumplings thick but not greasy, taste and onsen tamago the taste is very hierarchical, do not lose the whole dumpling squash soup Tom Yum !! flower crab delicious, believe me, this road special pumpkin soup Tom Yum other restaurants to eat less than perfect match, memorable Frontal !! main course we chose calf tenderloin with East Ocean, medium rare beef tenderloin with a layer of playmaker Fried oatmeal crisp above, savory sweet taste of Sichuan pepper sauce Zuo, this dish is very much like , East Ocean Zuohai gall grapefruit sauce, fresh sea right degree, prawn and octopus is eaten most soft and tender and juicy, eating flavors of steak, seafood is very tasty with grapefruit will also be cooking elevated to another realm !! brownie dessert with Matcha red bean mousse with crispy rice flower, really admire craft and creative chef Guo, the former dish to dessert, every bite is a wonderful taste and texture impact, well worth want to go so delicious package, thank you !!

I've been there a few times and had never been disappointed. Chef William, Restaurant Manager, Bar Manager - Anand and "Tom Cruise"(forgot his name) had been really lovely, ensuring that customers have nothing to complain about -- and truly we do not have anything to complain. If you do not have too much time in Singapore, and one restaurant & bar you need to visit, this is it! A lovely place to chill and end my week in for sure. Everything's easy there. You only need to ask...... :-)

Only suite Guests at MBS accommodation was the breakfast venue that can be used, but will enter the venue from alongside many people. Club 55 also choose Although food every morning and think about the degree of congestion and the view is by far the better of the 55. Type of cuisine is also 55, who also supports 55 of the staff is recommended. This venue is the question of the suite limited breakfast venue is.

Went there for a business lunch while attending a conference at the center. Food was ok, service was good, but nothing that would write home about.
Lunch (with desert) cost around SGD 90 per head
The servers are definitely not helpful, and very rigid about meeting customers' needs. I wont go back there. One time is good enough for me.

The restaurant is very good, good atmosphere. There sits chef Gordon Ramsey, sell good food, in addition to geese, other are very delicious! Respectively before and after the main course will eat bread and cookies, cookies good to eat, even eat appetizer entree, we eat the whole jar!
This Restaurant deserves to be No1 in the Steak business. The food is excellent and the steaks amazing in taste and texture. The Manager Ruben is running this place perfectly.

I had dinner here to celebrate our anniversary. We had a beautiful dinner and the steaks were superb. Wonderfully charred on top with medium rare perfection. I eat steaks regularly and it's really great to be pleasantly surprised when a place actually lives up to its reputation. Something very hard to do in today's day and age.

Review Title/URL: "Quite expensive meat dishes but can be sharaed if each has appetizer and dessert."
Review: Ambience is nice and the staff were accommodating. You need to reserve in advance though coz its always fully booked.

Definitely need booking in this restaurant. Music is too loud for fine dining, probably most of their patrons were talking and laughing loudly. Service was good though as waiter keeps checking if everything was ok. Beef was done nicely.

A variety of sides, sauces for your selection. Portion for sides are pretty big portion like onion rings , mussels, fries could share among 4pax each of those. Ordered filet mignon ordered a choice of sauce but think I can go without it because it is quite tasty by itself. Beef Sliders as sides or bar snacks was fantastic . Had 3 types of desserts from the menu can be shared as well all are good nothing is not nice there:) It is not as expensive as you thought probably order wisely of what you can eat should keep within cost. Make sure you get a Rough Love their signature cocktail !

Pretentious and over priced especially since the food was mediocre at best. We had four different main courses of which the sirloin was the worst dish. It was tough and tasteless. This was a medium rare order. Steaks are easy to marinate. A simple salt and pepper rub is enough to bring out the lovely flavour of a good cut. However they did not even manage this. The other three dishes are not worth the mention hut at least more enjoyable than the steak.

Firstly the whole restaurant is so poorly lit (very dim) that it was so difficult to read the menu. My Order was correct, hence the Average rating but my hubby's & daughter's were wrong. We suspected something was wrong when the food was served.. meat cuts were not as good as our 1st visit, very average. The service staff though seemingly polite were not very attentive & seemed very SMUG about themselves .. Our server didn't even repeat our order back to us. We were terribly disappointed !

Very good ambience for a night out with friends. Not really a place to bring small kids. We brought our kids and the restaurant staff tried to make our stay as comfortable for the kids as possible. Limited choices on the menu. Steak was of course very good. But it becomes a bit rubbery when it gets cold. So make sure to eat it as soon as it is served. Very good service by the staff.

Review Title/URL: "Go there for the bar not the restaurant"
Review: I've been only once to the restaurant for dinner and I don't see any reason to do it again. The food is good, no question about it, but it's really not special enough that would motivate a higher price level than most other top resurants offering high quality meats. Go to Luke's or Burnt Ends instead for great meat. What IS good however is the bar! Cut is a beautiful venue and their bar employs some great bartenders and also offers fantastic bar food. Best beef sliders in town! I give the restaurant 3 stars for it's low value for money. I give the bar 5 stars for great staff, dirnks and food.=> 4 stars.
Set lunch was ok, had the db sandwich. We were very happy with the tartare. Thats a great dish to try. Service was good. Place is very nice.

Review Title/URL: "Pizza is a Must and Chicken Wings can't go home without ...."
Review: Service is good. Food range is limited but the quality of food is important. Thumb Up for their " Special " pizza and chicken wings.
The Pizza here is incredible: great crust, tasty tomato, good toppings. However, better to look the other way when you are presented with the bill.

Breakfast in the morning at RISE Buyuffe. - That was good to with breakfast Buyuffe! Mood best. Me I'm enjoy a buffet so nice space! It can be a little column, row while Pokemon go. Pokemon is I come out more and more. Moreover Toka Wartortle, gallop? When I was a meal left on the screen has become fun because something comes out unusual just, been talking to waiter, I Pokemon are more to those who over there of a circular seat! I had been taught that. Pokemon Go big boom in Singapore. You see a person who is doing the Pokemon go everywhere. The contents of Buyuffe This also nice! Cheese types and, even nuts and dried fruit abundance. it's the best! Coconut jam also there is, or eaten toast, also kind of bread a lot. There are many about can not eat. Coriander entering Four also delicious, fruit also there was a melon. Juice is orange juice at the grain-filled, feel the juice I was squeezing. It is a big satisfaction.
Very good xiao long bao with foie gras! The fresh mushroom cappuccino is also my favorite. Good environment good service good food good view!

My mom visited Singapore & we saw all the sights but I left MBS for last. We were both really impressed by the food, mocktails, the service & of course THE VIEW. It's a little pricey since its the Marina Bay Sands but it's definitely worth it. We had a great time & I'll definitely be back.

Review Title/URL: "They having an event and was invited by BFF!~ :D"
Review:
1st time here the place is bit packed perhaps due to the event. free wagyu burger with any alcohol drink.
we ordered our food and then they got us a table further inside the restaurant. we had a cold octopus dish as starter, mini crab spaghetti and lastly our drool yum wagyu burgers!~ :D
I came here with my family for the first time. Food was great, service was brilliant, and atmosphere and location great! 10/10, very good value for money!

Tried their burger 2 times and still cannot appreciate the hype...
Very average beef.. Foie gras is average... Bun is below average.
Can skip is you want..
I love pizza but struggle with a concept of a pizzeria in a shopping mall (unfortunately common in Singapore). This place is quite good but not cheap and often overcrowded.

Tried their mushroom soup and lamb chop. They are fantastic. The mushroom soup is served in a CUP and you have to literally drink the soup from the cup. It's thick and creamy. The lamb chop is THE BEST! It came medium rare and it is so tender and juicy. Tried eating the lamb chop plain, then eat togather with the side dish, and then tried it with the gravy provided, the meat will give a different taste. Their house pour wine is good too. The only disappointment is the dessert. Nothing really special about it.

The restaurant-pub is on the 57th floor of the Hotel Marina Bay and the views are breathtaking. We went to the sunset time to see the sights of day and night and not know what decide to stay. We were lucky to be seated at a table with chairs on the terrace, there is not always space. And the waitress told us that not long ago they had freed these seats priced at $ 1000, before it had to pay to be there, but not anymore. Only obviously the price of drinks and food is superior to what you might find at street level but it is logical. We took a few cocktails for about 9-10 euros each. Also we chop something delicious, an enchilada meat typical of the country.

We decided to visit this amazing restaurant for our 10 year wedding anniversary and it was a delightful choice. My husband had the lobster and it was just outstanding. I had crab risotto which was also cooked perfectly . It was a fine dining experience but not stuffy!! We were there to have fun and celebrate and I think they picked up on our vibe and were relaxed and fun to be around ... Views are incredible as the sun sets and then a cocktail next door in Spago roof top bar was a nice way to finish off. Will certainly visit again next time we are in Singapore . Highly recommend . Fancy without the smancy!!!
Went there to celebrate my 29th birthday and it was truly a memorable experience! The service was impeccable and the food was AMAZING. Would definitely go back there for seconds (and thirds!)

We went there around 3pm so the restaurant was closed. But the waitress lead us to their bar upstairs and it was so lovely. We ordered some food and my favourite is the spicy tuna and crab pasta. They recommended a cocktail and its really nice :) They will open up the bar area to let some fresh air in and you can enjoy the view by the bay. Its really relaxing. You can also get some pokemons while you're chilling at the bar. ><

Visited chef Ramsey's restaurant on my first day in Singapore. Always wanted to try food in chef Ramsey's restaurant. We were welcomed with a beautiful smile, the ambience was good and the staff were courteous. We ordered dish of the day, which was pork that day and a duck dish. I have to say, I became a fan of duck that day. That duck just melted in my mouth. That day has been an amazing experience in Singapore. It's the place that you would want to start your trip and believe me it's the place where you would like to end it.

This Gordon Ramsay restaurant is in the Marina Bay Shoppes complex. On two levels. The lower level is within the shoppes and has a stairwell to the upper level, which is bigger and faces the promenade by Marina Bay with great views. Large glass windows and open air areas. Very busy so service can be hit or miss. Food is expensive, but for the area is really not too bad. Two of us each had a beer, appetizer, and entree and the bill was about $170. Food was terrific. Was particularly impressed by the cauliflower salad which had a unique blend of flavors. Cauliflower was sliced very thin, perhaps with a mandolin. Delicious.

Dishes excellent and well presented, portions perhaps a little 'minimal but it's worth trying. Prices are a bit 'above average but consistent with those of the restaurants in the Marina Bay area. Excellent tasting menu for lunch 2-course $ 40 per person (excluding drinks). friendly staff.
Would not eat here again. Good was nothing special and took far too long to arrive. Very expensive for what you actually get.

The place is popular so it was packed when we got there. Good thing we made reservations so we got seated right away. Service was excellent. Staff seemed knowledgeable about anything and everything Pizzeria Mozza. Congratulations! Overall, I enjoyed my Pizzeria Mozza experience but I think I might have to do that again and perhaps get something more adventurous than the goat cheese pizza we had. I also wish their pizzas would have less of that thick pizza dough at the edge. Their selection of wines though were really good. So yes, Pizzeria Mozza, I'm hoping to do that again with you.:)

We had diner last July and the view was just astonishing.
Unfortunately, our meals were note as good as expected (considering the place et the price!).
We had gnocchis that were overcooked as well as salmon ... Definitely, cooks need to follow a new trading for italian best cooking.
The wine was really expensive compared to similar places in Singapore.

Review Title/URL: "Terrace Dining on the Top of the World"
Review: Located on top of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Fabulous views in all directions. Dined on terrace adjacent bar. Casual and comfortable. Slow service. Good food, but not good enough for the price point, and not quite up to famous Mr. Puck's reputation. Can get a better burger and fries in the US at a far cheaper price.

I went with my girlfriend for lunch. September lunch for $ 28 person, which includes an appetizer, a pizza and iced tea (other drinks not included). The appetizer was the buffalo mozzarella (microscopic) and the pizza is like most in the cracker rather than a real pizza. For the price that I expected better. Local cute. Staff for the service a bit impetuous in removing the dishes and darting between tables.

I have always loved Gordon's restaurant food, however this time, we went for drinking only and to my surprise, they also do great drinks! I wasn't able to get the bar tender's name but i saw him in a website that he was one of the finalists in a competition for the best bartender in Singapore...and I'm so honored to share that he is a Filipino! Gordon must be proud of him. Next time, i'll try the food...also i'm scheduled to take lunch at the Hong Kong's Bread Street Kitchen! ?????? would love to try all Chef Gordon's restaurant! ??????

Very nice ambience and the food is good, a bit expensive but worth it. Service is attentive and couteous. Try the Coq Au Vin, tasty chicken french dish. A really cosy place to dine with friends, though toddlers may not be comfortable. Cut is ideally located at The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sand which is superb for shopping and entertainment.

Review Title/URL: Wide variety of food with a little sweet take away ?
Review: Just to make it clear, the take away was those chocolates in a jar! ?? you will surely feel full with the wide range of food they serve. The oyster was unforgettable...very fresh! ?????? the design and how the food were arranged is very inviting...felt like i'm on a healthy journey with the fruits, breads and salad dressings...the servers has been very nice to us, even if we didn't had reservations, they placed us in a very good location-near the buffet. ?? overall, the experience was good and i would love to come back again soon! ??????
We chose the Mediterranean sea bream and a burger with Morbierk„se and both very tasty. The service was excellent. Appetizer vain. Atmosphere was much appreciated. Gladly again!

Hubby wanted to take me to a nice resto before watching the show so he made reservations in this resto. Service was amazing and I give the staff 5 stars! The food was overrated ..everything we ate was spicy. From the mussels to the linguine to the chicken...we just didn't want to waste the food so we finished it but it's really nothing spectacular. Maybe the pizza joint beside it will be a better option in case u wander in this area ...

Review Title/URL: "One of my fav restaurants in Singapore"
Review: Every time I return to Singapore, a reservation at Osteria Mozza is important. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Singapore and it rarely disappoints. Reservation is important especially on weekends. I actually wanted to try the pizza place but the draw of what's familiar to me keep me back to Mozza. There's still so much on the menu to try!

Visiting from Australia and had lunch here to celebrate my husband's birthday. The business lunch menu appealed to us most. I ordered the French Brillat-Savarin salad with rocket, pine nuts, figs and watermelon. It was the most amazing salad I have ever eaten - perfectly balanced with lots of interesting textures! My main was a rack of lamb marinated in satay with tamarind juice - nicely cooked and tender. For dessert I had the berries with yoghurt icecream and panna cotta - again good balance of flavour with many textures. I have to say that all the food was impeccably and interestingly plated - don't think I have ever seen such pretty food that tastes so good! Look out for my pictures! Wait staff also brought out pandan birthday macarons with a candle for my husband, and sang happy birthday to him. A really nice touch!
enjoyed every bite with nice presented with a view from up here. no doubt a matter of taste.

Besides beautiful view also another fantastic and delicious eaten with surprising flavors. Surprise menu with 7 courses taken. Price is high but comparable with 1-2 star restaurants in En. Also the selected wines were top notch. Recommended!!

Amazing view. Super friendly crew. Delicious food and fancy cocktails!
I can highly recommend to go there.

Food is just out of this world. Thoughtful and skilful use of condiments and garnishes to bring out the flavours in the freshest ingredients - makes you realise great food is just that simple. Impeccable service and one of the widest selection of sake just adds on to the whole wonderful dining experience. Definitely worth more than the one star it's been given by Michelin.
Want to try the steak here is okay, other than the place easy to find, and comfortable place as well. for the hefty price is not cheap.
DB Bistro sell a variety of foods, ranging from heavy meals and snacks exist here. to place, easy discovery because it is a famous region. matter of taste is no longer questioned. prices depend.
same as Mozza pizzeria, osteria also sell pizza here. but no less tasty.
One Resto Pizza in Spore are getting the best degree there. to get a sense of Italian visitors can feel comfortable in eating food.

Considered one of the best restaurants in the Far East (and one of the most expensive), I must say immediately that the dinner we got to enjoy, after a reservation made months before, did not disappoint. More than a dinner is a ceremony, where everything is studied and prepared perfectly: the cook in front of diners prepares beautiful dishes to see and fabulous food; the maitre d 'that serves wines and tells them; the waiter who almost do not see and you need with absolute precision in the time and manner. The restaurant only offers a tasting menu of ten courses, upon request from intolerances or not foods you enjoy (much appreciated), optionally substituted with dishes just as the height. Some dishes are really extraordinary. The best albacore ever eaten raw "to the Japanese" to a sea urchin with shrimp and caviar (symbol plate restaurant) to eat with your eyes closed to enjoy the incredible balance of flavors, a wonderful dish with mashed potatoes, a egg, black truffle and caviar, all prepared before your eyes. Other dishes with ingredients stratospheric (wagyu beef, abalon etc.). Then you move into a "living room" room overlooking the large atrium of the shopping center but as a backdrop there is the beautiful bay of Singapore, to enjoy some very good desserts though not extraordinary as the other dishes. Excellent wines by the glass with paper up to the restaurant and prices beyond any grace of God. I trust that meets the expectations and therefore very "salty." Once in a lifetime definitely worth a try and if it happens, it will not be forgotten.

We had dinner at this place very intrigued by this Japanese / European cuisine. Dishes prepared with the highest quality ingredients (caviar, truffles, lobster, white tuna, ...), a triumph of flavors. Staff very, very friendly and knowledgeable. Something pleasant, the dessert is served in another room overlooking the bay of Singapore, a real treat.
Enjoyed the dining experience, especially the foie gras and tender meat cut that literally melt in your mouth! Definitely worth another visit again!

Needless to say well-known store in Japan and Hawaii, Wolfgang Puck, if you want to eat in Japan, we must go to Tokyo. So I went in the summer of travel destination Singapore. First, the restaurant of the interior was modern and nice. Seems to be a famous artist's painted, Art of the figures have been decorated on the wall. Restaurant in parentheses have been dropped lighting tones, makes me stand out more dishes even more! It is the meat of the essential lean, but soft and exquisite doneness, did not expect to enjoy the taste of the meat up to here with your red meat. In addition, side dishes of bread is this also is a rarity! Service is also very polite and friendly! Pricing is are you raise, the store is busy, you can dine while relaxing! Is a restaurant that also want to go when it is certainly visited the Singapore!

Excellent. Pasta absolutely extra, mozzarella of buffalo aperitif with various condiments to share great. friendly service and very professional. Nice decor. Flat, the price of wine is stratospheric ... Very good time for us.

I heard for the first time to book during the trip. Other than to come recommend profusely additional menu service is no problem, but the bottom line of the pizza is regrettable. The dough is quite hard, whole burnt stand out, cut is uneven, this if Domino ?? dove because a better person, thing reminiscent. Price is also high, it is not recommended for those who are eating the delicious pizza in Japan.

Visited BSK in early Aug 2016. The entire experience from the time of making the reservation to the time we finished our mean and left the restaurant was fantastic. The reservations team responded to my email promptly and gave us the impression that they were looking forward to us dining there as a result we too were excited about the meal! We tried quite a few dishes (starter, main and desert) between our group of 5 people and every dish we tried was exceptional in taste and as expected was a treat for the eyes as well. The service was fantastic with the wait staff constantly checking to see if we needed anything. Suggest you go for the desert platter if you are in a large group as it is more economical. The prices are those expected of a celebrity chef's restaurant. In my opinion it was money well spent! Would love to go back!

Review Title/URL: "Really good food and service (but at normal high Singapore prices)"
Review: Eating out in the Tourist areas of Singapore is not cheap. A pint of beer for œ10 is the norm. When compared to other places, the prices here are on a par, however the food is really good, the service is good and its a nice place to eat. It has a lovely setting in the Marina Bay Sands shopping centre and you can get a really good outside view if you are lucky.

Very large buffet restaurant inside tower 1 of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Buffet themes change on certain days for dinner, but the regular dishes are part of the lunch buffet, which is about $25-30 less than dinner. Meal includes water and coffee/tea, but no other beverages. Many, many, stations that include Japanese, Chinese, Indian, (other) Asian, western, fruit, salad, bread, cheese, and dessert. An abundance of food that will make you want to try everything. And nearly all of it was great. The service, too, was excellent. A good place to go after you have been in Singapore a few days off your regular diet and likely having eaten less than usual.
Excellent Italian waiter! His suggestions were spot on. Birthday card for my wife signed by all the staff was great and unexpected touch as well as the desert. Best meal in Singapore so far.

Service was excellent especially from Mr Catalin. Food presentation was great and prices are great especially for a fine restaurant. My wife and I were treated well as were celebrating wedding anniversary. The only issue was that I was told that long pants and collar shirt are a must but there were some guests in bermudas and t-shirt. Why the double standard?

Dough pretty good pizza. I took a red pizza with prosciutto and arugula. The sauce was sickly as sweet. My sister has instead opted for a pizza mushrooms and sausage. Sausage almost nothing, the pizza is packed with fungi much to make them come stomach pain for 2 consecutive days (risk of spoiling the tourists vacation).

Good, but the real pizza it is so much more! After 3 weeks of Asian food we wanted a decent pizza and indeed that of Pizzeria Mozza is. It is certain that you can not compare to the true Italian pizza; the ingredients are top quality but the result is not the same and even the cost! 185 SGD in two (about 130 Euros) for a daisy and a Neapolitan, 1/4 white, 2 Heineken wine, 1 dessert, 1 coffee and 1 lemon liquor.

Review Title/URL: "Gorgeous restaurant and wonderful service . On the top of Marina Bay Sands the view was incredible but the food !! "
Review: Fabulous food, the Fois gras is to die for !! Lovely evening with my gorgeous friends. Great venue, wonderful food and superb serviced

My wife and I celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary there and the staff at Spago did not disappoint. We were welcomed with a personalised congratulations card signed by the staff on the night and the service from there was impeccable. So was the food! My foie gras to start and quail for main were exceptional (particularly the foie gras) and my wife's gnocchi and chicken were also stunning. Peach mielle feuille for two to finish and we were stuffed with glorious food! Preferred it to L'Atelier de Jo‰l Robuchon where we had lunched earlier in the day.
Had the lunch buffet with family and was spoilt for choice. A wide spread of dishes to cater to all taste buds. Staffs were friendly and helpful.

I had my dinner celebration with friends at Rise Restaurant. The food selections were such a feast! Normally I just go back to the buffet station twice - for my appetizer & mains and once for desserts but here I lost track how many times I refilled my plate since I love all the cuisines served and they are so delicious! I was also surprised for the cake given and felt thankful for the staffs around me who sang joyfully. :) Most of all send my thanks to Jenny who always look after us, it was indeed a great birthday celebration for me. Thank you Rise Restaurant! :)

it would be easy for Spago to serve mediocre food as the location is just unique and makes it worth a visit but the food is one of the best I have eaten in a long time. Food quality and originality are of very high standards: laksa rolls, tuna tartar cones, salmon salad. The staff is diligent , the food is served at the right pace and the surroundings are unique. If I had to suggest one improvement, the menu could provide a bit more choices.
My wife and I went to dinner and, besides being one of the few that stayed open later, roast chicken that we totally worth it. YUMMY! tad expensive, but this is Singapore :)
pizzeria in, very average, but with spectacular prices as all resort complex in the marina bay sands. avoid

Great tasting pizza that reminded me of Rome and Florence. Book to reserve a table and definitely worth going to.
Pizzas had a nice thin base with crispy crust. You won't be disappointed!!!

I decided to book high tea for my husband's birthday thinking it would be just nice after our massage at a nearby spa! I had not mentioned the occasion when I booked a few days earlier so on the actual day, I called to confirm the reservation and check if they could possibly arrange for a birthday cake. It was too short notice but the lady who answered said they would put together a special birthday plate. It was raining when we arrived yet the restaurant was bright and light with touches of color from the floral pieces. We were greeted warmly and ushered to our table and as the panoramic iew disappeared before our eyes, we turned our attention to choosing a suitable tea for our small feast and enjoying the dishes. The xialongbao was a real treat and the accompanying mushroom capuccino was surprisingly just the perfect combination.....totally unexpected and thoroughly enjoyed! Exploring the savory dishes and sweet treats was fun...familiar tastes experienced in a new way. When the birthday plate was brought in by 3 of the staff singing happy birthday, even I was caught offguard. Birthday boy was pleasantly surprised so all in all a wonderful choice!! Look forward to the next visit...

The Restaurant is located in the second tower of the Marina Sands bay, Very nice selection of drinks and fine food , They have a few table at the outside terrace .. Take a drink at the terrace toward the end of the day 10:30 and you will be able to view the infinite pool and the city .

A friend was in town last night and suggested Spago. We don't normally eat in "Celebrity Chef" restaurants as we find them good, but generally overpriced. While Spago can be expensive, especially with some of their better wines included, it was very worth it and we will definitely be back. We shared three starters, the tuna cones, veal tarter and octopus. All three were so different and so excellent and unique. I then had the halibut laksa which was laksa, but so much more. I love laksa and the way it was done with a small amount of broth, noodles and delicious fish was a first and I will have to try again. We all enjoyed the meal and the quality of the food, preparation, taste and service all mean we will be back! Can't wait!

One of the Marina Bay Sands 'Celebrity Restaurants', Adrift lives up to expectations. The restaurant concept is based on the use of Japanese ingredients for European inspired cuisine, and it works a treat. The iberico pork chop in particular was spectacular , a certain challenger to steaks sold nearby. The complimentary sake and spices based cocktail offered on arrival is also memorable, as was our encounter with David Myers himself , who greeted diners toward the end of the evening. Service was attentive and courteous, and overall price reasonable compared to similar quality establishments. Highly recommended - if ever in Singapore again, I would certainly return.

Enjoyed BSK so much we ate here twice during our short stay in Singapore! Honestly, after 2 weeks in Asia I made the first reservation when I saw the burger and fries in the advertisement! I needed a good burger!! My daughter and I had the concierge at the Marina Bay Sands Shops make us a reservation with 2 friends. They only had high top tables available when we made the reservation but when we arrived they had a cancellation and we sat in the dining room. Food, service, and atmosphere was so good we returned a couple days later with my husband. We did not have reservations for our second visit, but we could sit immediately at the bar. We all enjoyed burgers on this visit. The guys behind the bar were fun, friendly, and entertaining!! Highly recommend!!!

A Gordon Ramsey restaurant quite busy with excellent food, my 16yo daughter and I were reluctantly ushered to the bar to eat. As it turned out we thoroughly enjoyed it, the food was good (but you should have seen my Daughters face when her fish dish arrived raw !! He He) We swapped dishes and all was good, the attentive bar staff kept us quite entertained too, would do it again.

It states now that the judgment is compared to the local rating and the amount spent. I saw both the chef's renowned / owner is to some reviews Top, also try this place screaming. Great disappointment. Good welcome, service very possibly too fast even though affable and level. internal environment too dark (it is hard to see in the pot) The table Then I did not like at all as was set (only a fork and knife resting on a placemat in plasticaccia Ikea style dark brown, dark towel also ... mah) for that alone, in view of alleged local rating, it does not reach the sufficiency. Overview of the sea is not very large but especially of earth (especially international cuisine) Good raw material. Tasted tuna tartare (discrete) and I'm famous Australian angus (valid) accompanied by a light wine barely .. (cellar I have to say very large and well-stocked), all for the modest sum over ? 120 each! (Watch the local price is compared to our prices, much higher). I can not say I have one bad meal, but I was expecting so much more ... and in an hour we had already finished (they turn the room several times with this system and fast service) starred Chef? NO THANKS !

friendly and polite staff. We ordered the New York Strip Steak. Cooked at the right point and tasty, accompanied with fries and delicious sauces. The prices are adjusted to the place where the Bistrot.

This used to be my favourite couple of years back. I am amazed at how much the quality has deteriorated. Seriously, how difficult can a cheese pizza be.. Whatever fancy name you give it. And the day's speciality .. Some dish of lamb on Fridays... Seemed to be the worst dish of the day. Go there for ambiance and brand name. They still seem to be banking on once good brand name. If you are going there for good food.. Don't bother.

It was my first visit, I'm not a pizza fan but seriously this place offers great pizza. I love the menu because they keep the pizza combination simple. It feels unpretentious and inviting. It was the burrata, tomato sauce and oregano that called out. And it was so good. The tomato sauce was intense and every bite felt so homey, comforting and authentic. (Imagine being transported into a traditional Italian home kitchen with its own wood fire oven where uncle or grandma churns out a thin crusted pizza with some basic pantry ingredients). Happy happy customer.

After two weeks of Thai food (excellent, actually), comes to nostalgia for strength and cuisine ... This pizzeria is right for every Italian in search of a corner of Italy ... I state that the pizza is not sublime or excellent, but it is good and it is left to eat ... it is not the typical Neapolitan pizza (how could it ?!) but it's not so far from the standards of good italic pizza, considering that the ingredients used are not bad (cured ham in my case), and using the wood stove. In short, you can do it, and I would add that this pizza is even better than many that you eat with us ... High prices of course, and much confusion every hour ... If you pizza purists avoided, if you know you will be satisfied to settle for sure

When I first sat down, the plan was to have a stiff drink while enjoying the afternoon setting sun. 57 floors up in the sky was a view that I want to see and I wasn't let down. Flipped through the menu and found the food pricing steep so I settled for a $12++ laksa. I was expecting a small sample bowl. But damn was I wrong! This bowl of laksa was generously big portion with 2 huge prawns. Yup. 2 prawns. Huge prawns swimming inside. Absolutely fabulous. Only some slight problems. Firstly, the table height was not good. Too low. So imagine flipping up the laksa rice noodles a great height while the 57 floor breeze was blowing... laksa gravy splurts and stains clothes. Next problem... it was described as a warning... Spicy. Well, let's just say that for local Singaporean taste, this was far from spicy. But hey all is forgiven. The views from the top was superb and I will surely come back again for a $12++ laksa. Definitely worth going up to see and get closer to the clear blue sky (if there is no rain and no haze).

Nothing about MBS dining will be that disappointing. They have acquired the best Michelin-starred chefs and establishments. Although Spago isn't one of them unlike DB Bistro, it's famed restaurant likened that in LAX earned its fair share of localised cuisine to local taste buds. Fancy a local 'kaya toast' served in a fine dining plate, all deconstructed! Very interesting dining concept and food. Service is typical of a fine dining restaurant, nothing utterly impressive. For the view, we were given a 'window' seat but were fully blocked by planters outside. Not impressed.

The restaurant is excellent in every aspect.
Food choice is wide, and all plates look tasty and well studied. The Rump Steak I had was perfectly cooked and very good.
Service is great. Waiters are very kind and polite and ready to fulfill all your requests in a very short time.
Highly recommended.

upscale restaurant in the heart of Marina Bay mall! Aesthetically, superb decor! Great impact at first glance, and professional and kind waiters! The meat quality significantly; full menu, extensive choices of the cuts. Personally, I enjoyed the Kobe sirloin, degree of marbling level 5, surely the high price but justified by the situation, and for the local reputation. Australian Wagyu, ribs-eye on the bone, very good, very fat but tasty. About 950gr priced at $ 360 in Singapore. Good contours of mashed potatoes and mushrooms id. Good judgment, and for that location for food. However, I argue that it is difficult to exceed a certain limit quality for meat arrived at a certain point, and then the surplus on the price is justified by the pleasant location and the attention you have in the room.

I find the place very impressive, especially the room surrounded by mirrors and bottles where I dined. Delicious breadsticks, bread and initial nibbles; dinner was level, but expensive: 700 ? for two (we have however chosen the best dishes on the menu).
Great food before play and fun nightcap after okay. Nice to have staff remember us. Look forward to returning

Review Title/URL: "The Pizzas are good (but expensive) but slow, slow service, but made the most of it and enjoyed the visit"
Review: Really good Pizza, but service very slow. My main course came at the same time as my sons, but then my wife had to wait ten minutes before her pizza came, not good !! Drinks expensive (that's true of all places in marina bay sands area. Enjoyed it, worth a call in, if you are in the area and don't mind ad hoc service

I have been to this place for lunch and I do not regret it. Having made the reservation through my hotel's concierge I arrived up at sky on 57. Out of the elevator I was warmly greeted by a hostess using my name, though I have never been there before!!! As I was early I asked to have a drink first at the entrance seating area. While enjoying my glass of wine I was always recognised by all staff members passing by. Seated, I started my lunch. I got a very good recommendation for food and wine from the service staff. I choosed chef's signature dishes and again I do not regret it. Whilst enjoying my lunch at a window table, provided without requesting for it with magazines, every service staff passing by my table showed a caring attitude with all of them using my name. This is what makes you feel special. I have to give a special thanks to my waitress Mika who did a fabulous job, very professional and caring for her guests. Food was really good, wine was top! Great wine list. Service wise my best dining experience in SG so far. Great to know that on top of this very busy Hotel Casino is a great place to dine. Will be back for sure on my next SG trip. Well done!

Wow, well where to begin with this place. Located at the very top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, this place has some serious aesthetic factors going for it! Beautifully designed, overlooking the infinity pool and with panoramic views of the city looking quite like a circuit board at night. We had some fantastic cocktails and enjoyed a selection of ?tapas? like dishes from their evening menu especially the laksa rolls! Yum! It is expensive even for a place like Singapore BUT it really is worth every dollar spent because you get the fantastic view, great service (we had a round of cocktails on the house too!) and especially good food. The best we had whilst in Singapore.
My besstes steak, totally nice people here use totally accommodating great recommendations, brilliant location, I'll definitely be back

Busted Bread Street Kitchen on a trip back to Singapore.
Not sure what the theme of the restaurant is? Food was average. Pork belly was too salty. Fish batter was tasteless.
Service was ok.
Honestly not sure why it is fully booked other than the name.
The rest of the chef Ramsey is divine, a super comfortable atmosphere and tasty food, I recommend it, and if they share is not as expensive, of course do not forget that Singapure is expensive

My girlfriend and I visited DB Bistro for a walk-in early dinner. We were immediately impressed with the friendly welcome and the casual chat as we were led to our table. As we were introduced to the menu, the very friendly, accommodating, and menu knowledgeable lady Mira took very good care of us from start to end. As it was our first time in the bistro, we requested for food recommendations which Mira happily advised; and advised well she did! We ordered the Tagliolini and the Mediterranean Seabass, and both were amazing. The bread basket before that with the served herbed butter is great! We also had a few other small things and all were awesome; especially accompanied by the great service from lady Mira. Our experience was that good that we actually came back the next day for their lunch menu :-). Thank you again for the wonderful meal and overall experience.

The spread was generous. From cold starters to fresh seafood and even piping hot and spicy local delights. And please, save room for the dessert which is a very stunning range of cream and chocolates. This is one buffet restaurant you must plant yourself at (while hunting for pokemons at MBS). If you're a Sands Rewards card member, even better, cos from Monday-Thursday you can get 30% discount, which helps a lot cos this buffet is not cheap. But for the price, you can prepare for feast including cold crabs, fresh oysters, the most tender vietnamese beef, softly steamed sea bass, even cheese that you didn't think exist. Yes this is a wide range of food to put into your body. The service is more than adequate. In fact, they aim to spoil you. They even offer newspapers (from several countries) so that you can read about the world while you dine. Spend time there. It runs from 6pm to 10.30pm (buffet dinner) so you have lots of time to recover from the binge... then continue again. Start slow, let it ride the evening away. Trust me, this is one epicurean adventure you must attempt.
even if you do not stay at trigrattacielo you can still get on the inside, must see

I decided to choose this place to celebrate birthday on 14 of August. Thank you for making the day special with your little surprise. The place, drink and food was excellent. staff also very helpful. Special thanks to Jerse who took care of me since the first time I made the reservation. Definitely will come back
Superb atmosphere . The staff were great in every way . The food scrumptious and unique in its own way .Thanks for making our anniversary extra special .

The views from the 57 floor were outstanding even in the smog. Our waitress was fantastic and attentive even though we only sopped for 1 drink. It was such a pity that we could not have a drink on the terrace, it was closed due to the smog, however we were welcome to walk around. Exquisite.

Review Title/URL: "Evening meal to celebrate my parents 50th Wedding Anniversary"
Review: This is an excellent restaurant, with great food and suitable for any special occasion. I arranged a surprise evening meal (along with a stay at the hotel) for my parents for their 50th wedding anniversary. I think because of the special occasion we were sat at a window seat and enjoyed the magnificent view. The staff at the restaurant were impeccable, efficient and explained the specifics of the menu with precision. I orders the whole main lobster, my partner had the roasted crackling suckling pig, my mother had the wild mushroom risotto and farther had dry aged grass fed beef. All thoroughly enjoyed. We ended the evening sitting on the terrace, enjoying drinks while watching the light show over the bay. It was a memorable evening for all.

Review Title/URL: "If it's not the food, then it's the view."
Review: Seriously classy, yet accessible. This is a restaurant you'd like to be at when you arrive in heaven. Best if you visit on a cool evening, since you won't want a thunderstorm to spoil your almost perfect view of the city and the bay. The servers are so attentive and you feel like a very important person, as they aim to make you feel like one (so that perhaps you can visit again). The food is great. Clean and fresh. Not gimmicky (since they are on the top of the hotel and I'm sure many would just try to get in for a coffee just to adore the view). The food is serious. Seriously stylish and plated with the greatest sense of artistic. You must eat here, at least once. Before you go to heaven.

The ambience of the surrounding is very relax and comfortable. We enjoy the food very much and the Laska spring roll leave the strongest impression for us and the steam Norwegian Salmon. We are definitely going back again.

It was superb! Brought my boss to celebrate his birthday here yesterday. They gave him a card with wishes signed by each of the wonderful staff @Spago.. Food was great! I loved the gnocchi surprisingly and it was 100x better than anywhere I have eaten. The dessert (chocolate and frozen banana) was excellent! Thank you for making the celebration extra special! Keep up with the great service! Vivien

Ok, nothing special, but full of people. Well located. Service quite good. Food all in all mediocre, burgers not even that. Good wine list if you specially remember ask for it. Noisy inside. Uncomfortable and narrow tables, beware not to hit your legs to the iron bar underneath the tables.
trendy decor line with Marina Bay but quite cold. relatively anonymous service. Very good meat overpriced but if you have enjoyed a Kobe Beef in Tokyo, do not expect the same level

They situated our sit near the biffet spread and it was awesome. Spacing in-between tables were ample and you can still enjoy private conversations between tables. Food was ok. Not so much of selections but it covers mainly the basic buffet spread. They serve local and international cuisine. Dessert was good, not much though. Hot dishes were delicious. Overall it was awesome. Pricey but worth it.

Review Title/URL: "exotic, tasty and delicious food, great service and cool venue"
Review: Probably one of the best restaurants in Marina Bay Sands (MBS). Excellent service, inventive and tasty food, lovely wine selection and great location. They even exchanged my vague ?free MBS champagne? for the champagne I chose rather than the house one I was supposed to have. They could have spoilt the night but they choose the higher ground (the voucher creative/T&C?s were not clear) which showed they valued my service. I would be delighted to return as the food was exotic and delicious.

What?s all the fuss about? Nothing special. In fact for these prices (one of the most expensive restaurants in Singapore) it was profoundly disappointing. They appeared to be doing things to win them Michelin stars and to impress rather than make interesting and tasty food and be sincere. There wasn?t a single dish which stood out on my fish/meat menu and the person I was with's vegetarian one. There are better Japanese restaurants at Pan Pacific and even Kinki beats it. Not worth the money, wine was exceedingly overpriced even for Singapore and the whole experience wasn?t especially enjoyable. Felt forced and insincere.
Had to give bread st a 5/5 purely because the wait staff were amazing! Honestly the best service ive had. The food was great, but not amazing.

Review Title/URL: "The steaks were the best we've ever had"
Review: Fantastic food, a must for any meat lover! The service is very friendly and accommodating, steaks were absolutely perfect - unfortunately the wines are on the expensive side.
Had a great lunch and a cold beer at the restaurant. Filipino bar man was very helpful. Curry chicken with Indian bread was spot on. The day time views are unbeatable as well.

Who wants to visit the Marina Bay Sands on top, is well advised, this evening in the "Sky on 57" - do bar. Although the cocktails are not cheap, but the view from the 57th floor over the harbor and the city are worth. The price performance ratio is unbeatable compared to the observation decks also on the 57th level. There you pay 22 SGD (about 14 euros) just to start up there. Because it makes more sense to spend 20 euros for a Singapore Sling (Entrance fees are not covered in the bar on)!

Review Title/URL: "Excellent location for an expresso on the bench top watching the crowd"
Review: First impression was negative as nobody acknowledged my entering the premises staff talking to each other About to leave, someone came to me and tried to recoup the bad start He did as i got after that proper friendly and efficient service, although I only ordered an expresso Coffee was very well executed, water service too. Cup design was good taste. Price tag 1 expresso SGD 6 + 10% svc charge + 7 % GST = SGD 7,06 A little pricey but worth it especially if you don't go to Singapore every day :) I will be back, thank you !

Taken by the desire of the flesh, we stopped at this place (definitely seen the location not cheap) that offered different types of meat. We opted for a classic steak, cooked really well and very tender; all served with fries and different sauces. efficient and discreet staff.

Had birthday celebration dinner on 3/9/2016. Initially was not up to mark . They served bread without giving any dips . Waiter did not seem to be attentive when requesting for bread n dips . We waited for awhile before they serve us . But as the dinner got along , it was fine without much issue . The birthday cake was served on the wrong person despite telling the waiter in advance . Food quality is about average . For the price we paid , i think they other better options

In the marina bay shopping center ... In the middle floor at the event plaza is located this restaurant with unicoa entry and single desk but two restaurants. Pizzeria and osteria (tavern that is not). The pizzeria was full ... We have therefore opted for the tavern. Appetizer courtesy .. An appetizer of cured meats and fried dumplings (a portion is for two people) un'amatriciana (the sauce was a bit 'stuck to the pan and tasted of burned), a plate of cavatelli with meat sauce, a piece of torta della nonna (it's actually a cheesecakes) a bottle of water and half a liter of wine. $ 200. I understand that you pay for the atmosphere but also the price compared to a good dinner but sena glory seems to me excessive. Cute waiter who lived in Como for 9 years. It pushes you to the generous tip. All in all good food ... Cake apart ... Unfortunately revisited by the lack of ingredients. Overall it deserves 4 stars.

Assuming that mango almost everything and I adapt to all kitchens, after days of Asian food we have to eat with my sister at this restaurant / Italian pizzeria. The restaurant is divided into a tavern and pizzeria; of course the pizza was to cu on were more people so we had to wait for their call (take the phone number and call you when your table is ready). We got two pizzas; the dough at the end was passable, but the dressing was too, too, too. The pizza was topped by my sister and my rocket full of mushrooms. In short, two pizzas and two pepsi ? 64.

Sky on 57 , situated on the 57th floor of Marinabaysands hotel. Lift was fast up there. Dress up nicely to get in there,no short or slippers. I got a standing table outside the bar, so I could see the top of Singapore at night time. It's wonderful time. Drink was good , with a free small cup of mix peanut. Price wasn't too bad, really worth to visit.

On 8 August, I celebrated my wedding anniversary with a wonderful dinner at the Sky Restaurant on 57 and I will remember for a lifetime. We arrive early and accommodated us to the sky bar to enjoy an excellent Singapore Sling in the beautiful setting of the illuminated bay with super Trees lights and headlights that project phantasmagoric images on the water. We chose the surprise menu with wine tasting and choice was never more apt. You start with caviar and champagne to go with black truffles, lobster, filet di.manzo .every reach a eccezionale.alla wine order an anniversary cake and another house. A good espresso and wonderful memories of this beautiful serata.per special occasion it is worth it. Thanks al.mitico Justin for his skill and his talent. Boccuzzi Giovanna

Great bar on the hotel roof with city views / great bay. Prices high but good atmosphere for evening relaxation to the oppressive sultriness shelter in the city. Cool breezes and cocktails on board the Infinity pool. Prices inevitably higher things

Review Title/URL: "After Cut US see u in Cut Sing!"
